    During the term of the franchise, the Grantee absolutely assumes and agrees to pay the City for, and the Grantee forever indemnifies the City against and agrees to hold and save the City harmless from, any and all damage, injury, costs, expenses, liability, claims, settlements, judgments, decrees and awards of every kind or nature whatsoever, including attorney's fees, costs and disbursements, that may never be claimed against the City by any person whatsoever, or on account of any actual or alleged loss, damage or injury to any property whatsoever, however arising from or related to or connected with, directly or indirectly, injury to or death of any person or loss, damage or injury to any property of the Grantee and/or the nonobservance by the Grantee of the provisions of any laws, statutes, ordinances, resolutions, regulations or rules duly promulgated by any governmental entity which may be applicable, directly or indirectly, to rights, privileges and authority, and the obligations and liabilities assumed by the Grantee under the franchise and/or the nonobservance by the Grantee of any of the terms and conditions of the franchise, and/or the granting of the franchise. 
(Prior code,  10.22.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-110. - Insolvency of Grantee. 
    In the event that the Grantee becomes insolvent or declares a bankruptcy or the priority of the Grantee comes into the possession of any receiver, assignee or other officer acting under an order of court, any such receiver, assignee or other such officer shall not be discharged within 60 days after taking possession of such property, the City may, at its option, terminate the franchise by giving written notice thereof to the Grantee. 
(Prior code,  10.22.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-120. - Default of Grantee. 
    In the event the Grantee fails to comply with any of the terms and conditions of the franchise within 60 days after receipt of notice in writing from the City specifying the failure or default, the City may, at its option, terminate the franchise by giving written notice thereof to the Grantee. This Section shall not apply to failures or defaults beyond the reasonable control of the Grantee. 
(Prior code,  10.22.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-130. - Termination. 
    In the event of termination or nonrenewal of the franchise, the Grantee, at its own expense, may remove all coaxial cable, amplifiers and any other items of equipment which may have been installed from time to time; provided, however, that, in the event that the Grantee is successful in concluding a sale or transfer, the Grantee shall be precluded from removing said equipment under the terms of this Section. 
(Prior code,  10.22.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Division 2 - Construction, Maintenance and Service 

Sec. 5-5-210. - Compliance with applicable laws. 
    During the term of the franchise, the Grantee shall comply with all governmental laws, ordinances, rules or regulations as may now be hereinafter applicable to the construction, operation, maintenance, repair, replacement, renewal, reconstruction and removal of a cable television system, the sale and supply of audio and video communications services, the use of public property and private property and the engagement in such further activities as may now or hereinafter be consistent with generally accepted principles applicable to the operation of a cable television system. 
(Prior code,  10.22.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-220. - Installation and maintenance of property of Grantee. 
    During the term of the franchise, the property of the Grantee shall be constructed, operated, maintained, repaired, replaced, renewed, reconstructed and removed in accordance with generally accepted engineering principles so as not to endanger or interfere with the lives of persons or to interfere with improvements which the City may deem proper to make or to unnecessarily hinder or obstruct pedestrian or vehicular traffic or use of public property or private property. 
(Prior code,  10.22.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-230. - Interference. 
    The Grantee's cable television system shall be designed, engineered and maintained so as not to interfere with the radio and television reception of persons who are not subscribers of the Grantee. 
(Prior code,  10.22.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-240. - Installation of cables. 
    The Grantee shall have the right, privilege and authority to lease, rent or in any other manner obtain the use of wooden poles with overhead lines, conduits, trenches, ducts, lines, cables and other equipment and facilities from any and all holders of public licenses and franchises within the City and to use such poles, conduits, trenches, ducts, lines and cables in the course of its business. The Grantee shall install its cable on the existing poles owned by other holders of public licenses and franchises with the City whenever possible for the installation of its cable. When installation of cable on poles is insufficient or when holders of all other public licenses or franchises have installed or have been required to install underground cable, then the cable used by the Grantee shall be installed underground. 
(Prior code,  10.22.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-250. - Restoration of ground surface. 
    In case of any disturbance of pavement, sidewalk, driveway or other surfacing, the Grantee shall, at its own cost and expense and in a manner approved by the City, replace and restore all paving, sidewalk, driveway or surface of any street or alley disturbed in as good a condition as before said work was commenced. 
(Prior code,  10.22.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-260. - Temporary removal of cables. 
    The Grantee shall, on the request of any person holding a building moving permit issued by the City, temporarily raise or lower its cables to permit the moving of buildings. The expense of such temporary removal, raising or lowering of cables shall be paid by the person requesting the same, and the Grantee shall have the authority to require such payment in advance. The Grantee shall be given no less than five days' advance notice to arrange for such temporary cable changes. 
(Prior code,  10.22.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-270. - Tree trimming. 
    The Grantee shall have the authority to trim trees upon any overhanging streets, alleys, sidewalks and public places of the City so as to prevent the branches of such trees from coming in contact with the cables of the Grantee. All trimming shall be done by an approved licensed tree trimmer at the expense of the Grantee. 
(Prior code,  10.22.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-280. - Line extensions. 
(a)  It shall be the obligation of the Grantee to serve all residents of the City except to the extent that density of homes, adverse terrain or other factors render providing service impracticable, technically unfeasible or economically noncompensatory. For purposes of determining compliance with the provisions of this Section and to provide for a reasonable and nondiscriminatory policy governing extensions of cable service within the City, the Grantee shall extend service to new subscribers at the normal installation charge and monthly rate for customers of that classification where there are an average of 40 homes per each linear mile of new cable construction. 
(b)  In the event the requirements of Subsection (a) above are not met, extensions of service shall be required only on a basis which is reasonably compensatory. 
(c)  The Grantee shall supply at no charge basic cable service to the Rocky Ford School District, which encompasses all schools within said school district and the school administration building, Pioneer Memorial Hospital, Rocky Ford Public Safety Building and Rocky Ford Golf Course. 
(Prior code,  10.22.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-290. - Service. 
(a)  During the term of the franchise, the Grantee shall furnish reasonable, adequate and efficient cable television service to subscriber terminals. 
(b)  The foregoing requirement may be temporarily suspended due to circumstances beyond the reasonable control of the Grantee. 
(c)  During the term of the franchise, the cable television system of the Grantee shall conform to the channel capacity and performance requirements contained in the then-current regulations of the FCC. 
(d)  The Grantee shall not cablecast, tape, reproduce or otherwise convey to its subscribers the activities of any recognized educational authority, public or private, without the written consent of the governing body of such authority. 
(Prior code,  10.22.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Division 3 - Miscellaneous Provisions 

Sec. 5-5-310. - Subscriber rates and service agreements. 
(a)  Subscriber rates and charges. The Grantee shall have the right, privilege and authority to establish and change the rates and charges to its subscribers for its services from time to time; provided, however, that, for the calendar years 1985 and 1986, the Grantee shall not increase the rate for basic cable television service by an amount in excess of five percent of the existing rate for said basic service per year without prior approval by the City Council. Effective January 1, 1987, the Grantee in its discretion may establish and change the rate for said basic service from time to time. 
(b)  Service rules and regulations. The Grantee shall have the right to prescribe reasonable service rules and regulations and operating rules for the conduct of its business. 
(1)  Such rules and regulations shall be consistent with the terms and conditions of the franchise. 
(2)  The Grantee shall file such rules and regulations and all amendments thereto with the City. 
(c)  Service agreements. The Grantee shall have the right to prescribe a reasonable form of service agreement for use between the Grantee and its subscribers. Such service agreement shall be consistent with the terms and conditions of the franchise. 
(Prior code,  10.22.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-320. - Payments to City. 
(a)  The Grantee shall pay to the City five percent of its annual gross receipts, less the Grantee's installation fees, for all cable programming services rendered to subscribers under this franchise. 
(b)  All payments as required by the Grantee to the City shall be made annually and shall be due 45 days after the close of the calendar year. 
(c)  Should the Grantee fail to make payment to the City of the franchise fee within the 45 days herein provided, the Grantee shall pay to the City interest on the amount due to the City under the provisions hereof an additional amount, to be calculated at the rate of one and one-half percent per month until paid in full. Such interest charge shall start to accrue on January first of each year during the term of this franchise agreement should the Grantee fail to make payments to the City as herein required. 
(Prior code,  10.22.060; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-330. - Crimes and penalties. 
(a)  Injury to property of Grantee. No person shall wrongfully or unlawfully injure the property of the Grantee. 
(b)  Intercepting signals of Grantee. No person shall wrongfully or unlawfully intercept the signals of the Grantee. If a wire, apparatus or other equipment of a cable television system has been altered or tampered with, a rebuttable presumption is created that the person lacking authorization of the cable system operator has created the condition as existing. 
(c)  Penalty. Any person violating any of the provisions of this Section shall, upon conviction, be subject to a fine not to exceed $100.00 or imprisonment not exceeding 30 days. 
(Prior code,  10.22.070; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-340. - Access. 
    The Grantee shall and does hereby grant to the City the right to enter upon the property of the Grantee, upon reasonable notice, at any and all reasonable times to inspect the same for purposes pertaining to the right of the City. 
(Prior code,  10.22.080; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-350. - Discrimination prohibited. 
    The Grantee shall not grant any undue preference or advantage to any person nor subject any person to prejudice or disadvantage with respect to rates, charges, services, service facilities, rules, regulations or in any other respect. 
(Prior code,  10.22.080; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 5-5-360. - Severability. 
    If any section, provision or part of this Article is adjudged to be unconstitutional, illegal, invalid or inapplicable to any person or circumstances, such adjudication shall not affect the validity of this Article as a whole, or any section, provision or part thereof not adjudged to be unconstitutional, illegal, invalid or inapplicable to any person or circumstances. 
(Prior code,  10.22.080; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
CHAPTER 6 - Business Licenses and Regulations 
ARTICLE 1 - Business Licenses 

Sec. 6-1-10. - Purpose. 
    The purpose of this Article is the regulation and registration of businesses operating within the City for the health, safety and welfare of the citizens of the City and to enable the City to enforce the obligation of businesses to remit sales, use and additional taxes to support the City. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-20. - License required. 
    When required by the City, every person must obtain a license from the City before operating, conducting or carrying on any retail trade, profession or business within the City. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-30. - Exemptions. 
(a)  Nonprofit state corporations, excluding federal, state or municipal corporations, are hereby exempt from the license requirements set forth in this Article. 
(b)  No exclusive religious, benevolent, charitable or educational society or association shall be required to obtain a license or pay a license fee for any theatrical performance show or exhibition. 
(Prior code,  4.06.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-40. - License application. 
    An application for a business license shall be made to the City Clerk on forms provided by the City. Every applicant shall state under oath or affirmation such facts as may be required for the granting of such license. It is unlawful for any person to make any false statement or misrepresentation in connection with any application for a license. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-50. - License fees. 
(a)  All annual license fees as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule shall be paid in installments of one-half, payable semi-annually in advance, on May 1 and on November 1 of each year, provided that: 
(1)  Each person required by this Section to secure a license by the year may do so after the first day of May, paying for such license at the rate herein provided for the full year beginning on May 1; and 
(2)  When said license is issued after May 1, the applicant shall pay at least one-half of the annual license fee in advance. 
    For all licenses not issued by the year, the full license fee shall be paid in advance in all cases. The provisions of this Section shall not apply to or in any manner affect any license heretofore granted. 
(b)  Before granting the license, the fee required for the license shall be paid at the office of the City Clerk. 
(Prior code,  4.06.040, 4.06.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-60. - Issuance. 
    The City Clerk may issue to the applicant the license upon receipt of the required fee and compliance with Section 6-1-40 above. 
(Prior code,  4.06.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-70. - Carrying or posting license required. 
    The license for a particular business location shall be posted at all times in a conspicuous place in the place of business. If the business is not operated, conducted or carried on at a fixed location, then the licensee must carry the license upon his or her person when operating, conducting or carrying on any retail trade, profession or business. Every licensee shall produce his or her license for examination when requested to do so by any police officer or by any person representing the City. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-80. - Separate license for each location. 
    Any person operating, conducting or carrying on any retail trade, profession or business within the City must obtain a separate license for each location of such trade, profession or business. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-90. - Transfer of license. 
    No license shall be transferred or assigned without the permission of the City Council, expressed by resolution to that effect, nor shall any such license authorize any person to do business or act under it except the person named therein. The license certificates shall be issued under the seal of the City and be signed by the Mayor and City Clerk. All moneys for licenses shall be paid to the Finance Director, and all bonds for licenses shall be filed in the office of the City Clerk. 
(Prior code,  4.06.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-100. - Renewal. 
(a)  An application for renewal of a general business license shall be considered in the same manner as an original application. 
(b)  Unless otherwise provided in this Chapter, all renewal applications and fees shall be due at least 30 days prior to expiration of the existing license. Any applicant who fails to submit the renewal application and fee within the required time shall be subject to the following additional fees: an additional 25 percent of the license fee for the first 15 days, and thereafter, and an additional 50 percent of such fee. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-110. - Suspension. 
    A license may be suspended: 
(1)  When any money due the City has not been paid. This includes failure to pay civil penalties, fines, taxes, impact fees or any other money owed to the City. 
(2)  When any activity conducted by the licensee or his or her employee or agent violates any federal, state or local rule, regulation or law. 
(3)  Upon failure to comply with the terms and conditions of the license. 
(4)  Upon any grounds of suspension provided by this Code. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-120. - Revocation. 
    Any license may be revoked at the discretion of the City Council: 
(1)  When it appears that the licensee has not complied with the provisions of this Chapter regulating his or her business or vocation. 
(2)  When it appears that the license was obtained by fraud, misrepresentation or false statements within the application. 
(3)  When it appears that the licensee has practiced fraud, misrepresentation or imposture. 
(4)  When it appears that the activity conducted pursuant to such license is a public nuisance as defined by this Code or statute or violates any federal, state or local rule, regulation or law. 
(5)  Upon failure to comply with the terms and conditions of the license. 
(6)  Upon any grounds of revocation provided by this Code. 
(Prior code,  4.06.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-130. - Notice and hearing prior to suspension or revocation. 
    All hearings to revoke, suspend or cancel a license shall be before the City Council. The suspension or revocation of any license shall not release or discharge anyone from his or her civil liability for the payment of the taxes, penalty and interest or from the prosecution of the offense. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-140. - Cease and desist. 
    If any business is operating without a license, the City Manager may issue an order to the business to cease and desist all further operation until a license is issued for the business. The order shall give the business three days to pay all amounts due the City, or to post a bond in the amount owing the City and to request in writing a hearing with the City Clerk. If the business does nothing, it shall cease operations on the third day. The hearing will be before the City Council. The proceedings shall not relieve or discharge anyone from the civil liability for the payment of the taxes, penalty and interest or from the prosecution of the offense. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-150. - Refund of fees. 
    Upon refusal by the City of any license or permit, the fee therefor paid in advance shall be returned to the applicant. In the event that any license or permit is revoked by the City, all monies paid therefor shall be and remain the monies of the City and no refund shall be made to any licensee or holder of a permit. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-1-160. - Violation, penalty. 
(a)  Each day that any person carries on, pursues, conducts or manages any business avocation or calling in the City without first obtaining a license therefor shall be deemed a separate offense, and such person may be convicted accordingly. 
(b)  Any person violating any of the provisions of this Article for which a fine or penalty is not herein specifically provided shall, on conviction, be fined in accordance with Section 1-4-20 of this Code. 
(Prior code,  4.06.060, 4.06.070; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 2 - Alcoholic Beverages 
Division 1 - General Provisions 

Sec. 6-2-10. - Intent and applicability. 
    The City Council finds, determines and declares that it is necessary to protect and preserve the health, safety and welfare of the citizens of the City by determining and declaring certain responsibilities, obligations and requirements of persons who hold liquor licenses issued by the City. 
(Prior code,  7.08.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-20. - Definitions. 
(a)  As used in this Article, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below unless the context otherwise requires: 
    Alcohol beverage or alcoholic beverage means fermented malt beverage or malt, vinous or spirituous liquors; except that alcohol beverage and alcoholic beverage shall not include confectionery containing alcohol within the limits prescribed by Section 25-5-410(1)(i)(II), C.R.S. 
    Fermented malt beverage means any beverage obtained by the fermentation of any infusion or decoction of barley, malt, hops or any similar product; except that fermented malt beverage shall not include confectionery containing alcohol within the limits prescribed by Section 25-5-410(1)(i)(II), C.R.S. 
    Licensed premises means any establishment or property for which the licensee holds any City and state license, other than a special event permit, allowing consumption of alcoholic beverages on premises. 
    Licensee means any person holding any City and state license permitting consumption of alcoholic beverages on premises, but excludes any person holding a special event permit. 
    Minor means any natural person under the age of 21 years. 
    Motor vehicle means a vehicle driven or drawn by mechanical power and manufactured primarily for use on public highways, but does not include a vehicle operated exclusively on a rail. 
    Open alcohol beverage container means a bottle, can or other receptacle that contains any amount of alcohol beverage and: 
(1)  That is open or has a broken seal; or 
(2)  The contents of which are partially removed. 
    Passenger area means the area designed to seat the driver and passengers while a motor vehicle is in operation and any area that is readily accessible to the driver or a passenger while in his or her seating position, including but not limited to the glove compartment. 
    Person means a natural person, partnership, incorporated or unincorporated association, company, corporation or organization, or a manager, agent, officer or employee thereof. 
    Private property means any dwelling and its curtilage which is being used by a natural person for habitation and which is not open to the public or is open to the public on a limited basis. 
    Public place means a place to which the public or a substantial number of the public has access and includes, but is not limited to, highways, streets, alleys, schools, parks, playgrounds, open public stairways, parking lots utilized by the public, grounds in public places, and buildings when open and accessible to the public for public purposes. 
    Retail license means a grant to a licensee to sell fermented malt beverages pursuant to the Colorado Beer Code (Article 46 of Title 12, C.R.S.) or a grant to a licensee to sell malt, vinous or spirituous liquors pursuant to the Colorado Liquor Code (Article 47 of Title 12, C.R.S.). 
    Retail licensee or licensee means the holder of a license to sell fermented malt beverages pursuant to the Colorado Beer Code or the holder of a license to sell malt, vinous or spirituous liquors pursuant to the Colorado Liquor Code. 
(b)  All other terms shall be defined as set forth in the provisions of the Colorado Beer Code, the Colorado Liquor Code and special event permits, as the definitions presently exist or may hereafter be amended. 
(Prior code,  4.02.020; Ord. No. 738, 5-26-1998; Ord. No. 814, 4-26-2005; Ord. No. 822,  2, 4-25-2006; Ord. No. 858,  1, 5-12-2009; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-30. - Application of state statutes. 
    The Colorado Beer Code, Section 12-46-101, et seq., C.R.S., the Colorado Liquor Code, Section 12-47-101, et seq., C.R.S., and special event permits, Section 12-48-101, et seq., C.R.S., as they presently exist or may hereafter be amended, shall apply to the sale of fermented malt beverages, alcoholic beverages, special malt liquors, spirituous liquors and vinous liquors in the City. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Division 2 - Liquor Licenses 

Sec. 6-2-110. - Power and purpose. 
    The City Council finds and determines that it is empowered by Section 12-47-505, C.R.S., to fix and collect certain fees in connection with the application for issuance, transfer and renewal of certain types of beer, wine and liquor licenses. The City Council further finds that the fees established in this Article are reasonable and are in amounts sufficient to cover actual and necessary expenses incurred by the City in connection with the handling of such licenses and applications therefor. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-120. - Licensing fees. 
(a)  The fees charged for liquor licenses by the City shall be set at the rate allowed by the State for statutory municipalities. 
(b)  Unless otherwise adopted in subsequent ordinances, the City shall not set fees less than the rate established by the State in its most current Fee Schedule. 
(Prior code,  4.02.010; Ord. No. 737,  1, 4-28-1998; Ord. No. 846,  1, 12-11-2007; Ord. No. 886,  1, 9-25-2012; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-130. - Prehearing conference. 
    In the event any person who is listed and designated as the licensee on a liquor license issued by the City is served with a notice of violation or notice to show cause for violation of the terms and conditions of that liquor license, the licensee or his or her representative shall be required to attend and participate in a prehearing conference with the Chief of Police and the City Attorney. The purpose of the prehearing conference is to discuss and negotiate the allegations and resolution of those allegations set forth in the order to show cause and notice of violation. In the event the parties are unable to show cause, the matter shall be set for hearing before the City Council, as provided by law, at a date which is convenient to all parties concerned. 
(Prior code,  7.08.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-140. - Suspension or revocation; fine. 
(a)  The City Council, acting as the Local Licensing Authority, shall have the authority to impose a fine in lieu of a suspension of a liquor license for all or a portion of the period of suspension under the following circumstances: 
(1)  The City Council has made a final decision to suspend the licensee's liquor license for a period of 14 days or less. 
(2)  Prior to the operative date of the suspension, the licensee petitions the City for permission to pay a fine in lieu of suspension. 
(3)  The City is satisfied that the following are met: 
a.  The public welfare and morals would not be impaired by permitting the retail licensee to operate during the period set for suspension and the payment of the fine will achieve the desired disciplinary purposes; 
b.  The books and records of the retail licensee are kept in such a manner that the loss of sales of alcoholic beverages which the retail licensee would have suffered had the suspension gone into effect can be determined with reasonable accuracy therefrom; and 
c.  The retail licensee has not had his or her license suspended or revoked, nor had any suspension stayed by payment of a fine, during the two years immediately preceding the date of the motion or complaint which has resulted in a final decision to suspend the retail license. 
(b)  The City may impose a fine of up to 20 percent of the retail licensee's estimated gross revenues from the sales of alcoholic beverages during the period of the proposed suspension; except that the fine shall be not less than $200.00 nor more than $5,000.00. All fines shall be paid in cash or certified funds, made payable to the City Clerk, and deposited in the general fund of the City. 
(c)  Upon payment of the fine pursuant to this Section, the City Council shall enter its further order permanently staying the imposition of the suspension. 
(d)  In connection with any petition pursuant to this Section, the authority of the City Council is limited to the granting of such stays as are necessary for it to complete its investigation and make its findings and, if it makes such findings, to the granting of an order permanently staying the imposition of the entire suspension or that portion of the suspension not otherwise conditionally stayed. 
(e)  If the City Council does not make the findings required in Subsection (a) above and does not order the suspension permanently stayed, the suspension shall go into effect on the operative date finally set by the City Council. 
(Prior code,  7.12.030, 7.12.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-150. - Educational requirements. 
    Every hotel and restaurant licensee, registered manager and licensee's employee is encouraged to obtain a certificate of completion from an educational program of training for intervention procedures for servers of alcohol. Those registered managers obtaining a certificate of completion may file a copy of the certificate of completion with the Authority with an application of renewal of a liquor license. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Division 3 - Regulations 

Sec. 6-2-210. - Minors in licensed establishments. 
(a)  Purpose. The purpose and intent of this Section is to prohibit minors from having access to or being on the premises of establishments where alcoholic beverages are sold for consumption on the premises at certain times. 
(b)  Prohibition. This Section shall pertain to any licensed premises. 
(1)  It is unlawful for any minor to be in or remain in or on any licensed premises from 11:00 p.m. to closing of the licensed premises for business that same night. 
(2)  It is unlawful for any licensee or his or her agents or employees to permit a minor to be in or remain in or on any licensed premises from 11:00 p.m. to closing of the licensed premises for business that same night. 
(c)  Exceptions. 
(1)  This Section shall not prohibit the minor children of the licensee or necessary employees of the licensee from being in or remaining in a licensed premises while the licensee or employee is actually working or performing. 
(2)  This Section shall not prohibit minors who are members of an entertainment group or the minor children of entertainment group members paid or employed by the licensee from being present in a licensed premises while the entertainment group is actually working or performing. 
(3)  This Section shall not prevent a minor from remaining on the licensed premises during a private party when the licensed premises are otherwise closed to members of the general public, provided that adequate adult supervision exists. 
    It shall be an affirmative defense to a violation of this Section to establish by a preponderance of the evidence that a minor at issue was required by the licensee or his or her agents or employees to produce a Colorado photo identification for viewing and that the Colorado photo identification produced by the minor was fraudulent. 
(d)  Penalties. Any person who violates this Section shall be subject to a fine of not more than $300.00. Prosecution of a person under this Section or imposition of a penalty under this Section shall not prohibit the City from taking other action with respect to the licensee's alcoholic beverage or 3.2 beer license. 
(Ord. No. 738, 5-26-1998; Ord. No. 814, 4-26-2005; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-220. - Consumption of alcoholic beverages in public places. 
(a)  Purpose. The City Council declares that the purpose and intent of this Section is to control and limit the consumption of alcohol beverages on property owned and controlled by the City within the City when used for private events, and that the control and limitation of such matters are in the best interest of the health, safety and welfare of the residents. 
(b)  Public consumption. It is unlawful for any person to consume or authorize the consumption of alcohol beverages in any public place within the City, except as provided in Subsection (c) below. 
(c)  Exceptions. The provisions of Subsection (b) above shall not apply to the following public areas: 
(1)  Play Park Hill and the Arkansas Valley Fairgrounds, when a person complies with the conditions set forth below: 
a.  A permit is properly obtained a minimum of 72 hours prior to the commencement of the serving of any alcohol beverage. 
b.  The permittee has appropriate authority to use the facility at which the fermented malt beverage will be served. 
c.  The only alcohol beverages served are fermented malt beverages. 
d.  The fermented malt beverages may not be sold. 
e.  The fermented malt beverages may be served only during the course of a picnic or other function where food is prepared or served. 
f.  The permittee has the permit in possession or posted at the public place at all times fermented malt beverages are being served. 
(2)  Any municipally owned property or other public place where the premises are properly licensed under state law for the sale of alcohol beverages and/or consumption on the premises. 
(d)  Permits. 
(1)  Application. The sponsoring person shall properly complete and sign a permit application. The application shall be submitted to the Police Department a minimum of 72 hours prior to the commencement of the serving of any alcohol beverage accompanied by the appropriate permit fee. 
(2)  Permit fee. The permit fee shall be as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. The City Council may amend the permit fee from time to time by resolution. 
(3)  Security. The sponsoring person must arrange for private security where a permit is sought for any site at the Arkansas Valley Fairgrounds or upon request by the Police Chief where the event occurs at Play Park Hill or near the Rocky Ford Golf Club. 
(4)  Permit issuance. Permits shall be issued or the application shall be denied by the City Manager following review and consideration. The City Manager may impose any reasonable conditions precedent to the issuance of a permit and may administratively adopt reasonable standards governing the issuance of all permits. 
(Prior code,  4.02.020; Ord. No. 822,  2, 4-25-2006; Ord. No. 858,  1, 5-12-2009; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-230. - Keg tagging requirements. 
(a)  Any retail liquor establishment selling alcoholic beverages by the keg within the City shall be required to affix to the keg, at the time of sale, a self-locking plastic identification seal. 
(b)  Any retail liquor establishment selling alcoholic beverages by the keg within the City shall be required at the time of sale to fill out an identifying form with information as to the purchaser's name, address, date of birth, driver's license number and date of sale. The Police Department shall provide the form. 
(c)  At the time of sale of any keg of alcoholic beverage, the retail liquor establishment shall be obligated to affix the seal, fill out the form and maintain those identifying records for purposes of inspection by the Police Department. 
(d)  Retail liquor outlets shall keep identifying forms for a period of six months, and said records shall be kept in a place open for inspection at all reasonable times at the request of the City. 
(e)  Any retail liquor outlet which fails to affix the plastic seal as required in Subsection (c) above, or to fill out the forms as required pursuant to Subsections (b) and (c), shall be in violation of this Section, and as such shall be subject to fines and penalties as authorized herein. 
(f)  Any owner or operator of any premises who, through act of omission or commission, fails to ensure that the owner's employees properly comply with this law, shall be guilty of violation of Subsections (b) and (c). 
(g)  It is unlawful for any person who has purchased alcoholic beverages by the keg within the City to remove the self-locking plastic identification seal required pursuant to Subsection (c). It shall not be a violation of this Subsection if the person removing the tag is an employee of an owner or operator of a retail liquor establishment or a representative of a vendor of wholesale alcoholic beverages, who removes the tag after the return of the keg to the place of retail establishment and after any deposit has been returned to the consumer. 
(h)  It is unlawful for any purchaser of a keg of alcoholic beverage to allow anyone to remove the fixed seal from the keg prior to its return to the retail liquor outlet which sold the keg. 
(i)  It is unlawful for any person to purchase a keg of alcoholic beverage pursuant to the terms of this Section, and to thereafter allow consumption of said alcoholic beverage by minors, unless said consumption is authorized and allowed pursuant to the laws of the State, as enumerated in Section 18-13-122, C.R.S. 
(j)  An owner, operator or employee of a retail liquor outlet who, upon receipt of a keg being returned by a consumer of the alcoholic beverage, shall inspect the returned keg, and, if the tag has been removed or tampered with in any way, the owner or operator shall immediately notify the Police Department of the same. It shall be unlawful for any owner, operator or employee to fail to notify the Police Department as required herein. 
(k)  It is unlawful for any person to be in possession of a keg of alcoholic beverage, wherein that keg was purchased within the City and the keg fails to have the appropriate self-locking plastic identification seal as required by Subsection (a) above. 
(l)  Any person who violates the provisions of this Section shall be subject to a minimum mandatory fine of $250.00 and a maximum fine of $1,000.00. 
(m)  The Police Department may use the penalty assessment procedure as provided in Section 16-2-201, C.R.S., for the enforcement of this Section. 
(Ord. No. 748,  1-13, 1-26-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-240. - Reporting of fights, disturbances or disruptions. 
    Any person listed and designated as a licensee on any liquor license issued by the City is hereby required to immediately report to the Police Department any and all fights, disturbances, disruptions or other violations of the law that take place in or about the licensed premises immediately upon the happening or such event, said report to include the names and addresses of all persons involved and all other relevant information. 
(Prior code,  7.08.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-250. - Telephone and alarm system. 
    Any person listed and designated as the licensee of any liquor license issued by the City shall be required to maintain on the licensed premises a telephone which is operational and can be utilized to notify the Police Department of any fight, disturbance or violation of the law on an emergency basis. For purposes of this Section, the term telephone does not include a pay phone on the premises. 
(Prior code,  7.08.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-260. - Penalty. 
    Any person who violates any provision of this Division may be subject to a fine as set forth in Section 1-4-20 of this Code. Any violation of the provisions of this Division may form the basis of a notice of violation and show cause why the licensee's license should not be revoked or suspended pursuant to proper notice and hearing. 
(Prior code,  7.08.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Division 4 - Optional Premises Licenses and 

Sec. 6-2-310. - Optional premises for hotel and restaurant license. 
    The following standards shall apply for the issuance of all hotel and restaurant licenses with optional premises permits for the sale of alcohol beverages within the City limits. 
(1)  Facilities for the outdoor sports of golf, rodeo and horse racing are eligible to apply for a hotel and restaurant license with optional premises permit. 
(2)  No licensee may have more than three optional premises on an outdoor sports or recreational facility. 
(3)  The applicant shall submit an addendum to the application stating the estimated maximum number of people who would be present at the sporting event at any one time. 
(4)  Where the maximum number of people estimated to be present at any one time at the sports event exceeds 100, the applicant must submit a security plan to the City stating the number of security personnel who will be present in such cases and shall provide the security personnel whenever more than 100 people are present at the sports event. 
(5)  The applicant shall file with the original optional premises permit application and with each successive renewal application a list of the optional premises locations. 
(6)  The applicant shall file with the original optional premises permit application and with each successive renewal application a diagram of each optional premises location on the list that clearly illustrates all areas where alcohol beverages will be sold and delineates the areas where sales will not occur. 
(7)  At least 48 hours prior to serving alcohol beverages on any optional premises, the licensee must provide written notice to the City and the State Division of Liquor Enforcement that the licensee will commence serving alcohol beverages on the optional premises and shall include the days and hours of said service. The licensee shall provide said notice prior to commencing service initially and prior to recommencing service following any period of time when regular service ceased. 
(Ord. No. 859,  1, 7-14-2009; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-2-320. - Special event permits. 
(a)  Findings. 
(1)  The City Council finds that the City staff possesses the necessary resources, time and expertise to process special event permit applications and render decisions thereon in accordance with applicable law. 
(2)  The City Council finds that electing for exclusive local control over the special event permitting process will provide a more efficient review of such applications without adversely affecting the quality or thoroughness of such review. 
(3)  The City Council desires to elect to assume exclusive local control over the issuance of liquor license special event permits. 
(b)  Local control. Pursuant to Section 12-48-107(5)(a), C.R.S., the City Council, acting as the Local Licensing Authority, hereby elects to exercise exclusive local control over the issuance of liquor license special event permits for events within the City. 
(c)  Report required. The provision of this Section notwithstanding, the City Clerk shall report to the Colorado Liquor Enforcement Division, within ten days after the City issues any special event permit, the name of the organization to which the permit was issued, the address of the permitted location and the permitted dates of alcohol beverage service. 
(d)  Review. Upon receipt of an application for a special event permit, the City Clerk shall, as required by Section 12-48-107(5), C.R.S., access information made available on the website of the State Licensing Authority to determine the statewide permitting activity of the organization applying for the permit. The City shall consider compliance with the provisions of Section 12-48-105(3), C.R.S., limiting to 15 the number of special event permits issued in any one year to any one organization, before approving any application. In addition, before approval, the City Clerk shall confirm the following when appropriate: 
(1)  Timely and proper posting of a conspicuous public notice sign as required by Article 48 of Title 12, C.R.S. 
(2)  Whether the applicant satisfies the eligibility criteria set forth in Article 48 of Title 12, C.R.S. 
(3)  After investigation, no sufficient grounds for denial appear to exist and no protests have been filed by affected persons. 
(4)  The applicant has not exceeded and does not propose to exceed the maximum number of special event calendar days permitted by Article 48 of Title 12, C.R.S. 
(5)  Each application for a special event permit shall be accompanied by an application fee as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. 
(Ord. No. 881,  1, 2-14-2012; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 3 - Peddlers, Solicitors and Dealers 
Division 1 - Transient Dealers, Peddlers, 

Sec. 6-3-10. - Definitions. 
    As used in this Article, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below unless the context otherwise requires: 
    Canvasser or solicitor means any person, whether or not a resident of the City, traveling by any means from place to place, from house to house or from street to street, taking or attempting to take orders for the sale of goods, wares and merchandise, or for services to be furnished or performed in the future, whether or not such person has carried or exposed for sale a sample of the subject of such sale or whether or not he or she is collecting advance payments for such sales; provided that such definition includes any person who, for himself or herself or for another person, hires, leases, uses or occupies any room, structure, building, shop, lot or other real property, alley, street, road, right-of-way or any other place or temporary location within the City for the purpose of exhibiting any samples and taking orders for future delivery. 
    Peddler means any person, whether or not a resident of the City, traveling by any means from place to place, from house to house or from street to street, carrying, conveying or transporting goods, wares and merchandise, offering and exposing the same for sale, making sales and delivering articles to purchasers or selling or offering to sell services to be furnished or performed in the future. 
    Person means any firm, corporation, limited liability company, association, club, partnership, limited partnership, society or other organization. 
    Temporary business means a person who establishes a business within the City with the intention and determination to remain within the City for a short period of time only, whether such period is definite or indefinite, or until disposition of a particular stock of merchandise has occurred. 
    Transient dealer means any person, whether or not a resident of the City, who engages in the temporary business of selling or selling and delivering goods and service within the City and who, in furtherance of such purpose, hires, leases, uses or occupies any tent, room, structure, building, shop, lot or other real property, alley, street, road, right-of-way or any other place or temporary location within the City. 
(1)  Transient dealer includes those persons not selling from stock but exhibiting samples for the purpose of securing orders for future delivery. The person so engaged shall not be relieved from complying with the provisions of this Article merely by reason of associating temporarily with a local dealer, trader, merchant or auctioneer, or by conducting such transient business in connection with, as a part of or in the name of any local dealer, trader, merchant or auctioneer. 
(2)  Excluded from the term transient dealer are manufacturers' representatives who supply wholesalers, dealers or merchants located in the City, merchants who have a permanent location within the City and who hold a current, valid Colorado sales tax license, local area farmers selling produce and persons who are invited into the City by the City. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-20. - Obstruction of street and sidewalk while conducting business. 
    It is unlawful for any person licensed or registered as specified in this Article to conduct business in such a manner as to attract a crowd which may cause the blocking or obstruction of any right-of-way, street, roadway, alley, sidewalk or other pedestrian access. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-30. - Temporary food establishment. 
    No person shall operate, own or maintain a temporary food establishment without inspection by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-40. - Conducting business without license. 
    It is unlawful for any person to engage in the business of a peddler, solicitor, canvasser or transient dealer within the corporate limits of the City without first obtaining a current and valid license as provided for in this Article. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-50. - Prohibitions on calling. 
(a)  Premises with signs. It is unlawful for any peddler, solicitor, canvasser or transient dealer to make an unsolicited call at a premises signed "No Solicitations" or words to that effect on or adjacent to the front door of the premises. 
(b)  Premises on no visit list. 
(1)  The City Clerk shall establish and maintain a list of addresses where the occupant or owner has requested that no peddler, solicitor, canvasser or transient dealer make an unsolicited visit at that address. 
(2)  The owner or occupant of any premises within the City may request the City Clerk, in writing, to place the address on a no visit list. When the requesting owner or occupant moves, the owner or occupant has a duty to notify the City Clerk so the address may be removed from the no visit list. 
(3)  The City Clerk shall provide the no visit list of addresses to each peddler, solicitor, canvasser or transient dealer who indicates an intent to solicit, peddle or canvass on a door-to-door basis. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-60. - Application for license. 
(a)  Every person desiring a City transient dealer's license, peddler's license, canvasser's license or solicitor's license shall first make written application with the City Clerk and shall submit the written application to the City Clerk, together with a nonrefundable application fee as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. The application fee is in addition to the license fee due when the City grants the license. 
(b)  The written application shall include, at a minimum, the following information: 
(1)  The applicant's name, residential address and telephone number. 
(2)  Whether the applicant transacts business on his or her own behalf or on behalf of another person and, if so, the name, business address, residence address and telephone number of such other person. 
(3)  The kind, class or nature of the goods, wares and merchandise that the applicant proposes to sell under the license. 
(4)  The names, residential addresses, business addresses and telephone numbers of the suppliers of goods, wares and merchandise that the applicant proposes to sell under the license when the applicant does not own the goods, wares and merchandise the applicant intends to sell. 
(c)  Where appropriate, the application shall be accompanied by the following: 
(1)  Written verification from the landowner of the property from which sales are to be made, authorizing the use of the property and said sales. 
(2)  Written verification of a sales tax license, branch sales tax license or special events license, as the case may be, certifying and verifying that sales tax will be collected and remitted to the City. 
(d)  The application shall contain such other and further information and/or request for information as deemed appropriate by the City. 
(e)  Following submission of a complete application, including all attachments and payment of the correct application fee, the City Clerk shall refer the application to the Police Department for further investigation. The Police Department shall verify the information contained in the application and shall check all other references and/or information deemed appropriate under the circumstances. The Police Department shall give written findings of its investigation to the City Clerk. 
(f)  After the City Clerk has received the completed application, appropriate application fee and a positive report from the Police Department, the City Clerk shall issue to the applicant a written license authorizing the applicant to engage in business within the City. 
(g)  Appeals. In the event the City Clerk fails or refuses to issue a license hereunder, or believes that the applicant is not required to have a license, the applicant shall be entitled to an immediate appeal to the City Manager. If the City Manager affirms the decision of the City Clerk, the applicant shall have ten days to file a written appeal to the City Council. The appeal shall be heard at the next regular City Council meeting that occurs at least ten days subsequent to the filing of the appeal with the City Clerk, at which time the applicant may present evidence and testimony as to why the license should be issued. The decision of the City Council shall be final. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-70. - Printed license, fee and renewal. 
(a)  Every person who desires to transact any business as a transient dealer, peddler, canvasser or solicitor within the corporate limits of the City shall first obtain from the City Clerk, during normal working hours, a written or printed license to engage in such business within the City, and shall pay to the City Clerk the license fees set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. 
(b)  Provided that there have been no violations of this Article and the proper amount of sales tax has been collected and remitted to the City, a transient dealer, peddler, canvasser or solicitor's license may be renewed for an additional term of the same length as the original license, so long as the request for renewal is made prior to or within 30 days after the existing license expiration date. Where the correct license fee is remitted with the request for renewal, the City shall waive the application fee. 
(c)  The written licenses issued by the City Clerk shall be consecutively numbered, state the time, location and purpose for which they were issued, shall be sealed with the City seal and shall further state that the license is nontransferable. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-80. - Exemptions from fees. 
(a)  No person shall be subject to the fee requirements of Section 6-3-70 above if he or she is bringing food products to the City for sale, either in bulk or by retail, from house to house, provided that such food products were grown or raised by the person so having them for sale and are products of the State. 
(b)  Fireworks stands are exempt from this Article, but must comply with the specific fireworks license regulations. 
(c)  A person exempt from federal income taxation under the provisions of the Internal Revenue Code shall be exempt from the fees required in Section 6-3-70. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-90. - Registration of nonprofit organizations. 
(a)  Any person engaged in short-term fundraising door-to-door within the City on behalf of a nonprofit or government-related organization, including but not limited to school organizations, Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts, 4-H and church organizations, does not require a license, but shall register with the City Clerk. 
(b)  Each person shall complete the same form as required for a license as set forth in this Article, but no fee shall be required. The registration for a nonprofit fundraising event shall be effective for a limited period of time, not to exceed 90 days. When the registration is for a youth organization and the youths participating in the fundraising are all less than 18 years of age, an adult representing the organization may register on behalf of the organization in lieu of individual registration. 
(c)  As part of the registration, the organization shall provide the City Clerk with written documentation demonstrating the nonprofit status of the organization. Acceptable documentation shall include, but not be limited to, a copy of an I.R.S. determination of nonprofit status or a letter from a governmental administrator, such as a school superintendent, stating that the organization is approved by and operates under the umbrella of that government organization. 
(d)  It shall be unlawful for any nonprofit organization to engage in door-to-door fundraising without registering with the City Clerk. Every person who unlawfully engages in door-to-door fundraising on behalf of a nonprofit organization without registering with the City Clerk as provided for in this Article shall be punished by a fine of not more than $300.00. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-100. - Records of application. 
    The City Clerk shall keep on file each application made for a license, a duplicate copy of each license issued and all papers filed in connection with any license issued, and shall keep a record of all license fees paid and all licenses issued that may be canceled. All such files and records shall at all times be open to public inspection. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-110. - Examination of license. 
    Every person licensed as a transient dealer, peddler, canvasser or solicitor, whenever his or her license is demanded of him or her by any police officer of the City, shall forthwith exhibit his or her license for examination by such officer. If he or she neglects or refuses so to do, he or she shall be subject to the same penalty as if he or she had no license. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-120. - Cancellation of license. 
    The license of any person who is convicted of a violation of any provisions of this Article shall be null and void from the date of such conviction and shall be canceled on the records of the City Clerk. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-130. - Unlawful engagement of business. 
    Every person who unlawfully engages in, or allows another to unlawfully engage in, on or about his or her property, the business of a transient dealer, peddler, canvasser or solicitor, and every person who transacts any business which would make him or her a transient dealer, peddler, canvasser or solicitor, without having a valid license as provided for in this Article, shall be punished by a fine of not less than $100.00 and not more than $1,000.00. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-140. - Unlawful actions. 
    No person shall make any false or untrue statement in an application for a license as a transient dealer, peddler, canvasser or solicitor. No transient dealer, peddler, canvasser or solicitor shall sell any manufactured goods, wares or merchandise as a transient dealer, peddler, canvasser or solicitor; sell any manufactured goods, wares or merchandise by any false or short weight; measure or sell any goods, wares or merchandise as being composed or manufactured in whole or in part of a material different from which such manufactured goods, wares or merchandise are actually composed or manufactured; or sell any manufactured goods, wares or merchandise which are partly or entirely of a poisonous or injurious character or nature, for consumption by human beings, animals or fowl or for application to the body, hair or skin of any human being or animal. Every person who is convicted of a violation of any provision of this Section shall be punished by a fine of not less than $100.00 and not more than $1,000.00. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-150. - Number of persons engaging in business. 
    No more than one person shall engage in business or operate under the same transient dealer, peddler, canvasser or solicitor's license, whether as principal, agent or assistant to any principal or agent. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-160. - Refusing to leave. 
    Any peddler who enters upon premises owned, leased or rented by another and refuses to leave such premises, after having been notified by the owner or occupant of such premises or his or her agent to leave the same and not return to such premises, shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-170. - Hours of operation. 
    It is unlawful for any peddler to engage in the business of peddling within the City between the hours of 5:00 p.m. and 10:00 a.m. the following morning or at any time on Sundays, except by specific appointment with or invitation from the prospective customer. 
(Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-180. - Violation of license. 
    Each day that any person engages in business or operates as a transient dealer, peddler, canvasser or solicitor, as defined in Section 6-3-10 of this Article, without first obtaining a license with the City Clerk, shall be deemed a separate offense, and such person may be prosecuted accordingly. 
(Prior code,  4.04.010; Ord. No. 838, 9-11-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Division 2 - Secondhand Goods Dealers 

Sec. 6-3-210. - Records required and books open for inspection. 
(a)  Any person who is or may become engaged in the business of buying, selling or otherwise handling secondhand goods, wares or merchandise shall keep a book in which shall be clearly written at the time of the receipt of any such secondhand goods, wares or merchandise an accurate account and description of such articles, goods, wares or merchandise, the amount paid therefor, the time of receipt thereof and the name and residence of the person from whom such articles or goods were purchased. 
(b)  The book shall at all times be open to the inspection of the City Manager or Chief of Police or any person who is duly authorized in writing by the City Manager or Chief of Police and who exhibits such written authority to the dealer. 
(Prior code,  4.04.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-3-220. - Penalties. 
    Any person who fails to keep the book as provided in Section 6-3-210 above, after being duly notified by the City Manager or Chief of Police of the necessity therefor, or fails to start such book immediately upon such notice, shall, upon conviction, be subject to a fine for each day that the person fails to keep such book. 
(Prior code,  4.04.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 4 - Tree Maintenance 

Sec. 6-4-10. - License and bond. 
    No person shall engage in, carry on or contract the business of removal, trimming, pruning or spraying of trees within the City without first having obtained a license from the City Clerk; provided, however, that no license shall be granted until the applicant has given a properly executed performance bond in the sum of $1,000.00, which bond shall run to the People of the City and shall be signed by the applicant and a corporate surety, and a certificate of liability insurance in the amount of $5,000.00. The annual license fee shall be as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. 
(Prior code,  9.08.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-4-20. - Rubbish. 
    It is unlawful for any person engaged in tree maintenance to deposit any rubbish, trimmings, branches, leaves or other residue from his or her contract obligation upon any City property, including streets and alleys, and the person so engaged shall be solely responsible for the removal and disposal thereof. In the event that the licensee fails to make such proper removal or disposal, the City may, in its discretion, remove and dispose of the same and make a direct charge to the licensee at the rate as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule per man hour for labor and as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule per hour for equipment. In addition, such failure on the part of the licensee shall constitute a violation of this Section and shall subject the licensee to the penalty provisions hereof. In addition, the annual license shall be automatically revoked. 
(Prior code,  9.08.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-4-30. - Damage from spraying. 
    All property damage caused by the spraying of trees, including such damage to surrounding buildings, automobiles and other personal property, shall be the responsibility of the licensee. Failure to compensate for such damage shall constitute a violation of the provisions of this Section and shall subject the licensee to the penalty provisions hereof. 
(Prior code,  9.08.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-4-40. - Inspection. 
    In the event of a violation of Section 6-4-20 or 6-4-30 above or an allegation that a violation hereof has occurred, it shall be the duty of the City Manager to make an inspection and file a report with the City Council setting forth the express violation. If the City Council determines that the licensee has violated the term of this Article, it shall be lawful for the City Council to instruct the City Clerk to suspend the license of the licensee and make application for forfeiture of the bond commensurate with the damages assessed. 
(Prior code,  9.08.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-4-50. - Suspension of license. 
    Any suspension of a license as provided herein shall continue until such time as the licensee has either: (1) obtained a signed release from the property owner upon which such violation occurred; (2) had the question of liability therefor determined in a competent court of law and filed a copy of said findings or judgment with the City Clerk; or (3) filed an additional bond in the amount of the damage claimed, said amount being necessary to maintain the level of the surety bond in the amount of $1,000.00 in excess of the claim so filed. 
(Prior code,  9.08.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-4-60. - Penalty. 
    Any person violating any provision of this Article shall be fined for each offense in accordance with the provisions of Section 1-4-20 of this Code. 
(Prior code,  9.08.060; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-4-70. - Forfeiture of bond. 
    In addition to the above provisions, in the event that any person is convicted of a violation of this Section in accordance with the terms hereof, the City may declare the required bond in default, or as much thereof as may be necessary for the payment of any fines levied hereunder. 
(Prior code,  9.08.070; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 5 - Non-Cigarette Tobacco Product Retail Licenses 

Sec. 6-5-10. - Findings and purpose. 
(a)  The City Council hereby finds that: 
(1)  The dangers associated with youth access to tobacco products are well recognized; and 
(2)  A local licensing system for non-cigarette tobacco product retailers selling non-cigarette tobacco products is appropriate to protect the health, safety and welfare of young people in the City. 
(b)  It is the intent of the City Council to prohibit sales of non-cigarette tobacco products to youth, to encourage responsible tobacco retailing and to reduce the impact of tobacco product use by young people in the City. 
(Ord. No. 902,  1, 9-9-2014; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-5-20. - Definitions. 
    The following words and phrases, when used in this Article, shall have the meanings defined in this Section unless the context clearly requires otherwise: 
    Arm's length transaction means a sale for valuable consideration between two willing parties. A sale between relatives, related companies or partners will create a rebuttable presumption that an arm's length transaction did not occur. A sale for which a significant purpose is to avoid the effect of the violations of this Article is not an arm's length transaction. 
    Cigarette means any product that contains nicotine, is intended to be burned or heated under ordinary conditions of use and consists of or contains: 
(1)  Any roll of tobacco wrapped in paper or in any substance not containing tobacco; 
(2)  Tobacco, in any form, that is functional in the product, which, because of its appearance, the type of tobacco used in the filler, or its packaging and labeling, is likely to be offered to, or purchased by, consumers as a cigarette; or 
(3)  Any roll of tobacco wrapped in any substance containing tobacco that, because of its appearance, the type of tobacco used in the filler, or its packaging and labeling, is likely to be offered to, or purchased by, consumers as a cigarette described in Paragraph (1) above. 
    The term cigarette includes roll-your-own; i.e., any tobacco that, because of its appearance, type, packaging or labeling, is suitable for use and likely to be offered to, or purchased by, consumers as tobacco for making cigarettes. For purposes of this definition, 0.09 ounces of roll-your-own tobacco shall constitute one individual cigarette. 
    Consumer means a person who acquires or seeks to acquire non-cigarette tobacco products for personal, family or household use. 
    Department means the Finance Director for the City and any agency or person designated by the Finance Director to enforce or administer the provisions of this Article. 
    Licensed, when used in reference to a retailer, means a retailer who holds a valid current license under this Article. 
    Non-cigarette tobacco product means and includes: 
(1)  Any product, other than a cigarette, that contains tobacco or nicotine, or is made or derived from tobacco that is intended or expected to be ingested, smoked, inhaled, placed in oral or nasal cavities or applied to the skin; or 
(2)  Any electronic device that can be used to deliver nicotine or tobacco to the person using the device, including but not limited to an electronic cigarette, cigar, cigarillo or pipe. 
    The term tobacco product does not include any product specifically approved by the United States Food and Drug Administration for use in reducing, treating or eliminating nicotine or tobacco dependence, or for other medical purposes, when such product is being marketed and sold solely for such an approved purpose. 
    Non-cigarette tobacco product retailer means a sole proprietorship, corporation, limited liability company, partnership or other enterprise that sells, offers for sale or otherwise offers any form of consideration for the transfer of a non-cigarette tobacco product to another party. 
    Person means any natural person, partnership, limited liability company, cooperative, association, corporation, personal representative, receiver, trustee, assignee or any other legal entity that engages in for-profit or nonprofit activity. 
    Self-service display means the open display or storage of non-cigarette tobacco products in a manner that is physically accessible in any way to the general public without the assistance of the retailer or employee of the retailer and a direct person-to-person transfer between the purchaser and the retailer or employee of the retailer. A vending machine is a form of self-service display. 
    Vending machine means any mechanical, electrical or electronic self-service device which, upon insertion of money, tokens or any other form of payment, dispenses product. 
    Youth-oriented facility means and includes any facility where residents, customers, visitors or inhabitants of which 50 percent or more are regularly under 18 years of age or which primarily sells, rents or offers services or products that are consumed or used primarily by persons under the age of 21. 
(Ord. No. 902,  2, 9-9-2014; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-5-30. - Requirements and prohibitions. 
(a)  Non-cigarette tobacco product retail license required. It is unlawful for any person to act as a non-cigarette tobacco product retailer in the City without obtaining and maintaining a valid non-cigarette tobacco product retail license pursuant to this Article for each location at which non-cigarette tobacco product retailing is to occur. Non-cigarette tobacco product retailing without a valid license is a nuisance as a matter of law. 
(b)  Lawful business operation. In the course of non-cigarette tobacco product retailing or in the operation of the business or maintenance of the location for which a license is issued, it shall be a violation of this Article for a licensee, or any of the licensee's agents or employees, to violate any local, state or federal law applicable to non-cigarette tobacco product retailing. 
(c)  Display of license. Each non-cigarette tobacco product retail license shall be prominently displayed in a publicly visible location at the licensed location. 
(d)  Positive identification required. No person engaged in non-cigarette tobacco product retailing shall sell or transfer a non-cigarette tobacco product to another person who appears to be under the age of 30 years without first examining the identification of the recipient to confirm that the recipient is at least the minimum age under state law to purchase and possess the tobacco product. 
(e)  Minimum age for persons selling non-cigarette tobacco products. No person who is younger than the minimum age established by state law for the purchase or possession of tobacco products shall engage in non-cigarette tobacco product retailing. 
(f)  Self-service displays prohibited. Non-cigarette tobacco product retailing by means of a self-service display is prohibited. 
(g)  False and misleading advertising prohibited. A non-cigarette tobacco product retailer without a valid non-cigarette tobacco product retail license, including, for example, a person whose license has been suspended or revoked: 
(1)  Shall keep all non-cigarette tobacco products out of public view. The public display of non-cigarette tobacco products in violation of this provision shall constitute non-cigarette tobacco product retailing without a license under this Code; and 
(2)  Shall not display any advertisement relating to non-cigarette tobacco products that promotes the sale or distribution of such products from the non-cigarette tobacco product retailer's location during suspension or revocation of the license that could lead a reasonable consumer to believe that such products can be obtained at that location. 
(Ord. No. 902,  3, 9-9-2014; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-5-40. - Limits on eligibility. 
(a)  A non-cigarette tobacco product retail license may only be issued to authorize non-cigarette tobacco product retailing at a fixed location. For example, non-cigarette tobacco product retailing by persons on foot or from vehicles is prohibited. 
(b)  No non-cigarette tobacco product retail license shall be issued to anyone under 18 years of age. 
(Ord. No. 902,  4, 9-9-2014; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-5-50. - License application procedure. 
(a)  Application for a non-cigarette tobacco product retail license shall be submitted in the name of each retailer proposing to conduct non-cigarette tobacco product sales and shall be signed by each retailer or an authorized agent thereof. It is the responsibility of each retailer to be informed regarding all local, state and federal laws applicable to non-cigarette tobacco product retailing, including those laws affecting the issuance of a non-cigarette tobacco product retail license. No retailer may rely on the issuance of a non-cigarette tobacco product retail license as a determination by the City that the retailer has complied with all applicable non-cigarette tobacco product retailing laws. 
(b)  A non-cigarette tobacco product retail license issued contrary to this Article, contrary to any other law or on the basis of false or misleading information supplied by a retailer shall be revoked pursuant to this Article. 
(c)  Nothing in this Article shall be construed to vest in any person obtaining and maintaining a non-cigarette tobacco product retail license any status or right to act as a tobacco retailer in contravention of any provision of law. 
(d)  Applications shall be submitted on a form supplied by the City and shall contain the following information: 
(1)  The name, address and telephone number of each owner of the retail business seeking a license. 
(2)  The business name, address and telephone number of the single fixed location for which a license is sought. 
(3)  A single name and mailing address authorized by each retailer to receive all communications and notices (the "authorized address" and "registered agent") required by, authorized by or convenient to the enforcement of this Article. 
(4)  If an authorized address is not supplied, each retailer shall be understood to consent to the provision of notice at the business address specified in Paragraph (2) above. 
(5)  Whether or not any retailer or any agent of the retailer has admitted violating, or has been found to have violated, this Article; and, if so, the dates and locations of all such violations within the previous five years. 
(6)  Such other information as the City deems necessary for the efficient administration or enforcement of this Article. 
(e)  A licensed non-cigarette tobacco product retailer shall inform the City in writing of any change in the information submitted on an application for a non-cigarette tobacco product retail license within 30 business days of the change. 
(Ord. No. 902,  5, 9-9-2014; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 6-5-60. - Issuance of license. 
    Upon the receipt of a completed non-cigarette tobacco product retail license application and receipt of the total license fee required by this Article, the City shall issue a license to the applicant unless a preponderance of the evidence demonstrates that one or more of the following bases for denial exists: 
(1)  The information presented in the application is inaccurate or false. Intentionally supplying inaccurate or false information shall be a violation of this Article. 
(2)  The application seeks authorization for non-cigarette tobacco product retailing at a location where this Article prohibits issuance of non-cigarette tobacco product retail licenses.
