If the order is by resolution, notice of the same shall be served upon the owner of the property to be assessed by delivering a copy of said resolution in person or by mailing the same to said owner. 
(Prior code,  9.02.090; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-3-100. - Special assessment of costs. 
    If any person fails or refuses to construct any sidewalk, curb or gutter in front of his or her premises when so ordered and within the time so provided, the City Council shall proceed to construct the same by contract, which contract shall include all portions of said improvement not constructed by the owner of the property adjacent thereto described in said ordinance or resolution. When completed, the entire cost shall be ascertained and assessed proportionately against the adjacent lot or land and the owner thereof; and thereupon, it shall be the duty of the City Clerk to extend said assessment in a book to be kept for that purpose. If the same is not paid by the owner within 30 days, it shall be the duty of the City Clerk to certify said assessment to the County Treasurer, who shall extend the same upon the tax roll and collect the assessment in the same way as other taxes against said property, provided that the cost of constructing said improvements across any intersecting streets or avenues or alleys shall be paid by the City. 
(Prior code,  9.02.100; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-3-110. - City Manager's estimate required. 
    Whenever the City Council, by resolution or by ordinance, has directed the construction or reconstruction of any sidewalk, curb or gutter, the City Clerk shall at once notify the Supervisor of Streets and the City Manager of such action. The City Manager shall at once prepare or cause to be prepared plans and specifications for said sidewalk, curb or gutter, or any one or more of them as the order directs, and shall deliver the same within 20 days to the City Clerk, who shall retain the same on file in his or her office and permit any person interested in the proposed improvement to see and examine the same. The plans and specifications shall include all detailed specifications for the proper construction of the improvement, a map of the district in which the improvement is to be made, an estimate of the cost and a schedule showing the approximate amount to be assessed upon the several lots or parcels of property within the district. 
(Prior code,  9.02.110; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-3-120. - Advertisement of improvements. 
    As soon as the plans and specifications have been approved by the City Council, the City Clerk shall at once prepare and cause to be inserted in a newspaper of general circulation in the City an advertisement calling for sealed bids for the proposed improvement. Said advertisement shall set forth the nature and extent of the proposed improvement; that plans and specifications therefor are on file in the office of the City Clerk and may be seen and examined by any interested person; the time during which bids will be received for the work, which time shall not be less than ten days from the date of the first publication of said advertisement; and the time and place where such bids will be opened by the City Council. In all advertisements, the right to reject any and all bids shall be reserved. The advertisement shall be notice to all owners of property to be assessed of the time and place of opening bids. 
(Prior code,  9.02.120; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-3-130. - Contract requirements. 
    At the time and place set forth in the advertisement, the bids received shall be opened by the City Council and the contract for the work let to the lowest reliable and responsible bidder, if such there be, in the manner and form as required by the laws of the State; provided, however, that no contract shall be let for a greater sum than the estimated cost of the City Engineer. If no bid received is acceptable to the City Council, the City may order advertisements for new bids or it may proceed to construct the work by day labor, under the direction of the City Engineer and the Supervisor of Streets, and cause to be drawn the necessary warrants to pay for said labor and for the purchase of necessary material as provided by law. 
(Prior code,  9.02.130; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 4 - Other Regulations 

Sec. 11-4-10. - Flooding of streets and alleys prohibited. 
    It is unlawful for any person using or having the control of water to willfully or negligently suffer or permit it to leave his or her premises and flow in and upon a public street or alley in the corporate limits of the City. This Section shall apply to all persons using water outside of the corporate limits of the City, as well as those inside the corporate limits of the City. 
(Prior code,  9.04.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-4-20. - Use of barbed wire limited near streets and sidewalks. 
    It is unlawful to erect, keep or maintain any barbed wire fence or barbed wire within three feet of the margin of any street open for use or within four feet of any sidewalk laid along any street within the corporate limits of the City. 
(Prior code,  9.04.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-4-30. - Obstruction and littering of streets and alleys prohibited. 
    It is unlawful for any person to throw, leave or deposit in any street or alley within the City tin cans, broken crockery, ashes, posts, poles, lumber, wire, wagons, vehicles or machinery or any other thing or substance that will interfere with the free passage of vehicles and equipment through or over the same. It is also unlawful to allow trees, bushes and/or weeds to grow in such a manner as to interfere with free passage of vehicles and equipment. All trees and bushes shall be cut back to the fence property line, weeds removed and trees trimmed so there is 14 feet of vertical clearance. 
(Prior code,  9.04.030; Ord. No. 764,  1, 5-23-2000; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-4-40. - Authority of City to remove obstruction. 
    The Mayor, any Council Member or the City Manager is hereby authorized to order any article or thing which may encumber or obstruct any street, alley or other public place to be removed; and, if such article or thing is not removed within one day after notice to the owner of the article, or his or her agent, to remove the same or to cause the same to be removed to some suitable place. The owner of any article or thing so removed shall be fined, in addition to the sums named, the amount of the expenses of such removal, which expenses shall also be recoverable in the same manner as expenses for the removal of nuisances, as set forth in Chapter 7 of this Code. 
(Prior code,  9.04.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-4-50. - Limitations for obstructive building materials. 
    The City Council shall not grant permission to place or to keep any building materials in any street or alley for a longer period than four months. Such permission shall not authorize the obstruction of more than one-third of the roadway and one-half of the sidewalk except in cases of urgent necessity and for short periods. Such permission shall be deemed void when ever the person to whom the same is granted extends the obstruction beyond the limits prescribed herein. 
(Prior code,  9.04.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-4-60. - Placing building in streets and alleys prohibited. 
    Every person who erects or places any building in whole or in part upon any street, alley, sidewalk or other public grounds within the City shall, upon conviction, be fined in accordance with the provisions of Section 1-4-20 of this Code. 
(Prior code,  9.04.060; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-4-70. - Notice of removal of obstruction. 
    The owner of any building, fence or other obstruction now standing or which may hereafter be erected or placed upon any street, alley, sidewalk or other public ground within the City limits shall remove the same within 30 days after he or she is requested to do so by a notice in writing signed by the Mayor or City Manager. 
(Prior code,  9.04.070; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-4-80. - Violation of notice to remove obstruction. 
    Whenever the owner of any building, fence or other obstruction standing or encroaching upon any street, alley, sidewalk or other public ground in this City refuses or neglects to remove the same after notice as provided in Section 11-4-70 above, the cause shall be deemed a nuisance and it shall be lawful for the Mayor to cause the same to be taken down at his or her discretion. The expense thereof shall be recoverable from the owner in an action of debt or by assessment on the premises in the manner provided for other municipal charges and assessments, and every person who opposes or resists the execution of the order of the Mayor made in pursuance hereof shall be fined in accordance with the provisions of Section 1-4-20 of this Code. 
(Prior code,  9.04.080; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 5 - Park Regulations 

Sec. 11-5-10. - Regulation of hours. 
    All municipal parks, including but not limited to Library Park, Railroad Park and Play Park, shall be open to the public for use by the public each calendar year during the daylight hours only, subject to the following exceptions, which shall permit additional use to be made of the particular named parks: 
(1)  Library Park may be used during the nighttime hours for the express purpose of going to and from the library. 
(2)  The facilities of Play Park may be used after the daylight hours and until 11:00 p.m. only in such areas where proper lighting facilities have been provided, and then only so long as such lighting facilities are in operation. The picnic facilities shall be available for use until 11:00 p.m., so long as the lighting facilities are in operation. 
(3)  No restriction shall be made with regard to Play Park for use by the City in the conducting of the Rocky Ford Golf Club and the use of the golfing facilities by club members and their guests. However, when the golf club facilities have been closed by the duly authorized representatives of the Rocky Ford Golf Club, then these facilities shall be closed to use by the public at all times, including the daylight hours. 
(4)  The City Manager is authorized to order the temporary closure of any public park, or sections thereof, to use by the general public, with or without advanced notice, when it has been determined that: 
a.  The closure is necessary to protect members of the public from possible injury due to actual or anticipated circumstances or conditions; or 
b.  The closure is necessary to protect the recreational or other facilities within a public park from damage or destruction due to actual or anticipated circumstances or conditions; or 
c.  The closure is necessary to facilitate maintenance or repairs; or 
d.  The closure is warranted because the public park or facilities within a public park have been reserved for use by authorized persons, teams or organized groups for athletic events, practices, contests, tournaments or other special events authorized by the City Manager pursuant to contract, agreement or park use permit. 
(Prior code,  9.06.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016; Ord. No. 935,  1, 5-22-2018 ) 
Sec. 11-5-20. - Conduct. 
    In no event, during the period of time for authorized use, shall anyone commit injury to public property, conduct himself or herself in a disorderly fashion or disturbing manner or carry on any type of anti-social conduct which should be barred from any public place. 
(Prior code,  9.06.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-5-30. - Traffic. 
    All traffic on park property shall be limited to a maximum speed of 15 miles per hour; otherwise, all of the provisions of Chapter 8 of this Code shall be applicable in dealing with traffic. 
(Prior code,  9.06.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-5-40. - Penalties. 
(a)  Any person found entering into or upon the park facilities above described other than at the time permitted by this Article shall be deemed guilty of a breach of the peace. 
(b)  Any person found guilty of committing injury to public property in violation of the terms of this Article, if over the age of 18 years, shall be subject to a mandatory fine of not less than $50.00 nor more than $300.00. 
(c)  All parents of minors under the age of 18 years, which minors have been found committing injury to public property in the park systems described by this Article, shall be individually and collectively liable in an amount not to exceed $300.00 for such injury committed, and the City shall have full authority to commence a civil action at law against said parents for the recovery of all damages resulting from injury to the public property and disorderly conduct by said minors, plus all court costs and reasonable attorney fees. Such action may be commenced in the name of the City in any court of record of competent jurisdiction within the State. 
(Prior code,  9.06.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 6 - Street Numbering 

Sec. 11-6-10. - City streets to be mapped. 
    The City Manager shall cause to be prepared, from time to time, maps of the streets of the City, showing the numbers of all houses and in all cases where the numbers of all houses shall hereafter be changed. The same shall be renumbered in the manner provided by this Article. 
(Prior code,  9.10.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-6-20. - Assignment of street number. 
    The City Manager shall assign each house its proper number and, upon application, shall deliver to the owner or occupant thereof a certificate designating said number at a cost to such owner or occupant, not exceeding a fee as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule for each number. 
(Prior code,  9.10.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-6-30. - Provisions for numbering. 
    The buildings fronting on all streets shall be numbered by plain, distinct figures, not less than three inches in length, placed upon a conspicuous portion of the front of such buildings. The numbers shall be as follows: 
(1)  Commencing at the center of the BNSF Railway Company right-of-way as now located on all streets running in a northerly and southerly direction therefrom, the first number shall be 100, and so commencing they shall be numbered consecutively until the terminus of the railway right-of-way. The first numbering of the block on each side of said right-of-way shall commence with the number 200 and be consecutively carried forward to the end of the block. The first number of the second block shall commence with the number 300 and so consecutively carried forward until the terminus of the block. All other blocks extending north or south shall be so numbered, commencing with consecutive hundreds for each additional block to the limits of the City, as the same now is or may hereafter be constituted and laid out. 
(2)  The even numbers shall be on the east side and the odd numbers on the west side on all streets running in a northerly or southerly direction. 
(3)  Commencing at First Street, on all streets running in an easterly direction, the first number shall be 100 for the first block, as heretofore designated, and consecutive hundreds for each additional block to the limit of the City, as the same now is or may hereafter be constituted or laid out; except for the blocks lying between Ninth and Tenth Streets, the following number shall be given: 
a.  Commencing at Ninth Street, in all blocks lying between Ninth Street and Main Street, the first number shall be 900 and be consecutively carried forward to the end of the block. 
b.  Commencing at Main Street, in all blocks lying between Main Street and Tenth Street, the first number shall be 951 and be consecutively carried forward to the end of the block. 
c.  On all streets running in an easterly or westerly direction, the even numbers shall be on the south side and the odd numbers on the north side thereof. 
(Prior code,  9.10.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 11-6-40. - Frontage allowed to each number. 
(a)  The frontage allowed to each number on all streets running in a northerly or southerly direction shall be the width of the lot to which the number is given. 
(b)  On all streets running in an easterly or westerly direction, 20 feet shall be given to each number. In dividing any lot into Sections of 20 feet for the purpose of numbering, the fractional parts of 20 feet shall in all cases come next to the alley. 
(c)  Where a residence, place of business or other building stands partly on one space and partly on another, the number given shall be the lowest given to either space by this Section. Where there are two residences or places of business on one numbering space, the one nearest the side where the numbering begins shall take the proper number for the space on which the same is located and the one adjoining on the same shall add one-half to the number. 
(d)  All streets running in a northerly or southerly direction from the center of the BNSF Railway Company right-of-way, as herein mentioned, shall have the word "North" prefixed to their names, and all streets running in a southerly direction from said line shall have the word "South" prefixed to their names. 
(Prior code,  9.10.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
CHAPTER 13 - Municipal Utilities 
ARTICLE 1 - Utility Accounts 

Sec. 13-1-10. - Purpose and intent. 
    The purpose and intent of this Article is to establish a utilities deposit fee and utilities late payment fee. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.010, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-20. - Deposit payment. 
(a)  Each person establishing a utilities account with the City for a property owned by the person shall make a utilities deposit with the City in the amount set forth in the City's Fee Schedule for each utilities account established. 
(b)  Each person establishing a utilities account with the City for a property not owned by the person shall make a utilities deposit with the City in the amount set forth in the City's Fee Schedule for each utilities account established. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.020, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 865,  1, 2-23-2010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-30. - Definitions. 
    As used in this Article, the following terms shall have the following meanings: 
    Customer means the person or entity for whom the utilities deposit was made. 
    Number of utilities accounts shall equal the number of water taps that exist on the premises for which utility service is being requested. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.030, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-40. - Water rental due date. 
    Water rentals shall be due and payable monthly at the City Utilities Office on the twentieth day of each month, without notice. All connections on which water rentals are not paid on the twentieth day of the month shall be shut off. Water shall not be turned on again through said connections, except upon the payment of all unpaid water rents, late fees, disconnect fees, reconnect fees and a new or additional deposit. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.030, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-50. - Deposit period. 
(a)  Property owned by customer. Where the customer owns the property being served, the customer may request the return of the deposit after making 12 consecutive utility bill payments in full on or before the due date. Where the deposit was not previously returned, the City shall return the deposit upon payment of the customer's final bill. 
(b)  Property not owned by customer. Where the customer does not own the property being served, the City shall return the deposit only upon payment of the customer's final bill. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.040, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 865,  2, 2-23-2010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-60. - Deposit application and forfeiture. 
    Where the City cuts off service to a utilities account for nonpayment of any City-provided utility and the customer has not brought the utilities account current or made payment arrangements satisfactory to the City within 15 days of the cutoff date, the City shall apply the deposit to the utilities account. The customer shall not be entitled to a refund of any amount of a deposit applied to a utilities account pursuant to this Section. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.050, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-70. - New deposit required. 
    Where the City has applied a deposit as provided in this Article, the customer shall make a new deposit prior to reconnection. The new deposit shall be the greater of the deposit set forth in the City's Fee Schedule required of that class of customer or the sum of the last three months of utilities billings, excluding any extended payment billing. In computing the new deposit, the customer shall be given credit for any remaining deposit amount after application of the deposit pursuant to this Article. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.060, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 865,  3, 2-23-2010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-80. - Late fee. 
    A late fee shall be applied to each utilities account when the customer fails to pay the full amount due on or before the due date. The term full amount due shall not include arrearages not due in a particular billing period as a result of an arrearage payment plan previously approved by the City. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.070, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-90. - Disconnect fees and reconnect fees. 
    The City shall charge a disconnect fee as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule when any water connection is shut off pursuant to this Article. The customer shall pay a reconnect fee as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule prior to the City water service being reconnected once shut off pursuant to this Article. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.075, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-100. - Appeal. 
(a)  A customer may appeal a late fee, disconnect or reconnect fee or new or additional deposit to the City Council after attempting to resolve the issue with the City Manager. The City Council shall apply the following criteria in determining the appeal: 
(1)  Whether the rentals and any fees due were paid timely; 
(2)  Any extraordinary circumstance that prevent timely payment, including but not limited to hospitalization or an unexpected and sudden emergency trip out of the area; and 
(3)  Whether a reasonable person could have paid the rentals and fees under the circumstances. 
(b)  Inability to pay due to lack of funds shall not constitute an extraordinary circumstance. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.080, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-110. - Waiver. 
    A late fee may be waived by the City Manager upon application by the customer and a showing by the customer of the following criteria: unusual, nonrecurring mitigating circumstances and a prior timely utilities account payment history. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.085, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-1-120. - Deposit, fee and rental changes. 
    The City Council may by resolution reduce or increase the utilities deposit, late fees, disconnect fees, reconnect fees and commodity rentals. 
(Ord. No. 793,  10.11.090, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 2 - Water Regulations 
Division 1 - General Provisions 

Sec. 13-2-10. - Purposes of use of water. 
    In an application to the City for water use, the applicant must state fully and truly all purposes for which the water supplied to him or her will be used and, at any time when called upon, must frankly and without concealment answer all questions put to him or her regarding the consumption of water. In said application, the applicant shall agree that he or she will not in any case, except by permission of the City Manager, permit water to be used for any purpose on premises adjoining the premises for which said taps are made and said service pipes installed and that he or she will comply with all ordinances, rules and regulations of the City, now or hereafter to be established, concerning the water system and the use of water therefrom. The applicant shall further agree that he or she will be responsible for the rentals due the City for all water drawn through said tap so long as he or she retains the title to said premises. 
(Prior code,  10.04.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-20. - Pollution of, diversion of and interference with public water prohibited. 
(a)  It is unlawful for any person in any manner to pollute the water in any reservoir, pipe line, lateral ditch or other conveyance or receptacle used by the City in storing, conveying and distributing water to the inhabitants thereof, or to cast into said reservoirs, pipe lines, lateral ditches or other conveyances or receptacles any garbage, offal or any other substance or thing. 
(b)  No person other than the proper officials and employees of the City shall: 
(1)  Dig, cut or break down in any manner any embankment, dike or cutting connected with any reservoir or lateral ditch used by the City; 
(2)  In any way injure or interfere with any head gate, flume, waste gate or division box in any of said lateral ditches or reservoirs; 
(3)  In any manner whatsoever interfere with the flow of water in said lateral ditches or the pipe lines leading from said reservoir or used in distributing City water; and 
(4)  Divert from any reservoir, pipe line, lateral ditch or other conveyance or receptacle used by the City in storing, conveying or distributing water, except as provided in this Article. 
(Prior code,  10.04.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-30. - Exclusive tapping rights of City. 
    The City hereby reserves the exclusive right to tap all mains and place service pipes to the line of curbing and to do all excavating in any street or alley required to be done in connection herewith. 
(Prior code,  10.04.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-40. - Property owner required to make application for water service. 
    Whenever the owner of any premises within the City desires to obtain water for his or her premises from the water systems of the City, the owner or his or her agent shall make and file with the City Clerk an application in writing, accompanied by a sufficient cash deposit, to pay all expenses and costs of making said tap, installing the meter and putting in service pipe to the curb. 
(Prior code,  10.04.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-50. - Water supplied to property owners. 
    Water shall be supplied to property owners only, and the rates, charges and rentals for the use of said water, as fixed, determined and assessed by the City Council, shall be payable by the owner and/or occupant of the premises or property to which said water is supplied. All such rates, charges and rentals shall become and remain a lien upon the property and premises to which said water is supplied from the date of the maturity thereof until the same is fully satisfied and discharged, and said lien may be enforced as provided below. All accounts and records shall be kept in the name of the owner and/or occupant of the property or premises to which water is furnished, and all notices shall be given to the owner and/or occupant or his or her agents or personal representatives. 
(Prior code,  10.04.050; Ord. No. 801,  2, 12-9-2004; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-60. - City Manager to record taps. 
    Whenever the City Manager makes a new tap or changes the connections now existing, he or she shall at once make a complete record in his or her office upon the map of the water system. 
(Ord. No. 801,  3, 12-9-2004; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-70. - Disconnection and reconnection. 
    In the event the water rents, late charges or assessments are not timely paid pursuant to this Article, the water service to the premises shall be disconnected and shall remain disconnected until all rents, late charges, assessments and disconnection and reconnection fees are paid in full. If an occupant moves to another premises that receives water from the City and has failed to pay all rents, late charges, assessments and disconnection and reconnection fees incurred at the occupant's previous premises, the water service to the occupant's new premises shall not be connected and the water service to the occupant's previous premises may be reconnected. When an occupant fails to pay the final rents, late charges, assessments and disconnection and reconnection fees for his or her previous premises at the end of the first billing cycle for the occupant's new premises, the water services shall be turned off until all rents, late charges, assessments and disconnection and reconnection fees are paid in full. 
(Ord. No. 801,  4, 12-9-2004; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-80. - Liens. 
    If water rentals, charges, assessments and fees have not otherwise been paid by the property owner, user, occupant or former occupant and remain unpaid, they shall become a lien upon the property to which the service was rendered as indicated by the County tax rolls. 
(Ord. No. 801,  5, 12-9-2004; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-90. - Notice of costs and charges; hearing. 
(a)  A notice of the costs and charges shall be sent to the property owner, as shown by the County tax rolls, by certified mail, return receipt requested, at the address shown on said tax rolls. The property owner may request a hearing before the City Council to contest the amount of charges and costs. Such request must be made within ten days of the receipt of the notice, and said hearing shall be held not less than ten nor more than 30 days after the request for hearing. The decision of the City Council shall be final. 
(b)  When no hearing is requested or when, after the hearing, the statement of charges and assessments remains unpaid, the statement of assessment and charges shall be certified to the County Treasurer, along with the name of the property owner and legal description of the property, to be collected by the County Treasurer in the same manner as real estate taxes upon the property. 
(Ord. No. 801,  6, 7, 12-9-2004; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-100. - Supervision by City Manager. 
    All connections, disconnections or alterations made to service pipes on premises, or at intersections of line between the street and alley, must be under the supervision of the City Manager, acting under advice of the City, as to the kind of pipe and other material to be used and the manner of construction or alteration to be made. When such work is completed, the contractor or such person doing such work shall file with the City Manager a statement to that effect. 
(Prior code,  10.04.060; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-110. - Uncontrolled cross-connection prohibited. 
(a)  Definitions. As used in this Article, the following terms shall have the following meanings: 
    Backflow preventer means a device accepted by the Department of Public Health and Environment for a specified type of cross-connection that prevents backflow and that is approved for installation at a specific location by the Superintendent of Water and Wastewater. 
    Cross-connection , in this Section, means any point in the water distribution system where chemical, biological or radiological contaminants may come into contact with potable water. 
(b)  Cross-connection without installation of an approved backflow preventer for the specific type of cross-connection is prohibited. 
(c)  Each installed backflow preventer shall be tested annually by a certified backflow prevention technician. 
(d)  Backflow preventer testing and maintenance records shall be kept for three years from the date of testing or maintenance. 
(e)  The water supply to any cross-connection without an approved backflow preventer shall be shut off where the cross-connection is not disconnected or a backflow preventer installed, and shall not be reconnected until the cross-connection is disconnected or an approved backflow preventer is installed and the corrective measure is inspected by the Superintendent of Water and Wastewater. 
(f)  The City Manager shall inform the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment of the uncontrolled cross-connection and the corrective action being taken. 
(g)  Any person who violates this Section shall be subject to a minimum fine of $100.00 and not more than $300.00, and each day that such violation continues shall be deemed a separate offenses. 
(Ord. No. 831,  10.04.065, 5-8-2007; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-120. - Connecting to City water systems. 
(a)  No connection with the water system shall exceed three-fourths inch in diameter, unless permission of the City Manager is obtained prior to installation of the connection. No person using or having control of any service pipes in the City shall permit any person to use water from said service pipe on any adjoining or other premises, except by prior permission of the City Manager. The City shall not be liable for damages by reason of the breaking of any service cock or service pipe. 
(b)  In case of fraudulent misrepresentation on the part of the applicant or use of water not embraced in the applicant's application, or the violation of the City's ordinances, rules or regulations concerning the use of the water and the water systems, the City Manager may at once shut off the water from the premises on which the violation occurred, and the water shall not be supplied again to said premises except upon satisfactory assurance that the wrongful use of water will not thereafter occur and the payment of all damages sustained by the City according to the estimate of the City Manager. 
(c)  Any person feeling aggrieved by the action of the City Manager pursuant to Subsections (a) and (b) above may appeal said matter to the City Council for its decision, in which case the City Manager shall proceed in accordance with the instructions of the City Council. 
(Ord. No. 794,  10.04.070, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-130. - Water scarcity. 
    In case of scarcity, the City Manager may limit the hours during which lawns may be irrigated or may prohibit lawn irrigation entirely. Upon service of a notice by the City Manager under this Section limiting or prohibited lawn irrigation, all persons shall strictly comply with the requirements of said notice. Upon failure to do so, the City Manager may at once shut off the water from the premises on which the violation has occurred, and said water shall not be reconnected again except upon the payment of a reconnect fee and satisfactory assurance that further violations will not occur. Upon the City Manager's determination that sufficient water exists to lift the water use restrictions or prohibitions, either temporarily or permanently, the City Manager may cause the restrictions or prohibitions to be lifted, shall report said action to the City Council at its next regular meeting and shall then follow any City Council instructions. 
(Ord. No. 794,  10.04.075, 12-9-2003; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-140. - Interference with meter or meter box prohibited. 
    No person shall in any manner obstruct or interfere with any meter or meter box. 
(Prior code,  10.04.080; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-150. - Separate meters. 
    More than one residence shall not be supplied through any one meter, and each residence must have a separate meter. 
(Prior code,  10.04.090; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-160. - Authority to order meter for each occupant. 
    Where there is more than one occupant or any building or premises, the City Council shall have the power to order a separate meter installed for each occupant, and thereafter water shall be supplied to such occupant only through the meter so installed. 
(Prior code,  10.04.100; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-170. - Meter required. 
    No person shall take or use water through or from the water pipes or water system of the City except through a meter, excepting water through a tank, and shall pay for such water at the established rates, payable on the first day of each and every month. The City Manager may grant permission to any person to permit water to be used on adjoining or other premises for building operations, in which case the person through whose pipe line said water is delivered shall be responsible for the payment of water so used. The City reserves to itself the exclusive right to supply water to water tanks, and the City Manager shall collect for each tank of water the sum set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. The City Council may by resolution charge the water rates herein specified or make new rates for the use of water not above provided for. 
(Prior code,  10.04.110; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-180. - City's exclusive right to conduct water within City limits. 
    The City hereby reserves the sole and exclusive right to conduct water along and across any and all streets, alleys, avenues or parks within the limits of the City. 
(Prior code,  10.04.120; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-190. - Authorized persons to control water flow through City-owned ditches. 
(a)  It shall be the duty of the City Manager to control and regulate the running water in all ditches belonging to the City. The City Manager shall have full charge of said ditches and the water flowing therein and shall distribute said water for the proper use of those entitled thereto for the proper irrigation of the parks of the City and the trees in the City. 
(b)  It shall be the duty of the City Manager to cause water to flow through and along stated streets at regular intervals, as far as practicable, and to give public notice thereof by publishing or posting schedules of the probable time of the flowing of water for irrigation use through the different sections of the City. 
(Prior code,  10.04.130; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-200. - Reserve taps. 
(a)  Water taps may be reserved for a period not to exceed six months upon payment to the City of the tap fee in effect upon the date of reservation. Reservation of water taps may be renewed from time to time for periods of six months each upon payment of the difference between the tap fee in effect upon date of reservation and any additional tap fee rate in effect upon the date of renewal. Failure to renew the reservation as provided in this Subsection shall terminate the reservation, and all monies paid under reservations shall be forfeited to the City. 
(b)  Upon payment to the City of all costs for materials, labor, equipment and pavement replacement, the City shall install and connect the meter. 
(Prior code,  10.04.140; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-210. - Water Conservancy District. 
    The City Council has given consent for the inclusion of the City within the boundaries of the Southeast Colorado Water Conservancy District. 
(Prior code,  10.02.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Division 2 - Water Rates and Charges 

Sec. 13-2-310. - Water rates and charges. 
    Rates for water taken from or used through the water pipes of the City shall be as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. 
(Prior code,  10.10.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-320. - Water tap charges. 
(a)  The charge for tapping into or connection with the water system of the City shall be as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. 
(b)  The charge for tapping onto or connection with the water system of the City for any size of service line over two inches shall be subject to contract with the City upon negotiation. If the meter is larger than the service line or the service line is larger than the meter, the tap fee shall be based on the larger size. 
(c)  The City Council may by resolution reduce or increase the rate of charge and classify or reclassify any recipient of such water for rate purposes, and may further establish by such resolution the charge to be assessed against any future industrial or business water recipient. 
(Prior code,  10.10.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-330. - Waiver of water tap fees. 
(a)  Purpose and intent. The purpose and intent of this Section are to establish a procedure and method for the City to set, adjust, modify, amend or waive its tap fees for connection to the City water system. 
(b)  Water tap fees. No water tap onto the City water system shall be made except by the City after application and upon such terms and conditions as determined by the City Manager or as provided herein. All tap fees shall be paid when the request for the tap is made. For each tap, the City will furnish the labor and one tap fitting. The cost of excavation, if done by the City, and repair of main lines, if broken by parties other than City personnel, will be charged to the party requesting the connection. All fees and charges paid in accordance with this Section shall be deposited into the Water Fund, together with all other Water Fund revenues derived by the City. Upon motion of the City Council, such funds may be transferred to the General Fund from time to time, as may be determined necessary. The City Council shall be entitled to set, modify, amend, waive or otherwise determine the water charges or fees to be charged for tapping into or connection onto the City water system. Said rates, charges or fees shall be set, modified, amended or waived from time to time by resolution of the City Council. 
(Prior code,  10.10.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-340. - Turn-on and turn-off fees. 
(a)  Property owner liable for service charge. From and after the date on which a service pipe is installed for any premises, the owner of said premises shall pay to the City the stated charges for the use of water as fixed by ordinance or resolution and, whether using water or not, shall pay the minimum rate during all the time the premises are occupied. In case of the property owner's neglect or refusal to pay all the rates herein specified, including the minimum charge for the period during which said premises are occupied, but water not used thereon, the rates shall be charged against the property owner and the property, and the water shall not again be turned on to the premises until all such delinquent charges are paid in full. 
(b)  Service charges. Services charges to be charged to each water recipient shall be as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. 
(Prior code,  10.10.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-350. - Service line. 
(a)  Cost of installing water service pipes charged to party requesting such services. The Water Department is hereby authorized and directed to charge the cost of installing water service pipes or water service lines connecting the water mains of the City to any water meter to the person requesting the installation of such water service pipes or water service lines. 
(b)  Payment made within 30 days after completion of installation. The Water Department is hereby authorized and directed to discontinue the distribution of water to any person to whom such charge is made in the event that such cost has not been to the City within 30 days after completion of the installation. Service shall not be restored until the charge has been paid in full. 
(Prior code,  10.10.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-360. - Penalties. 
    It is unlawful, after water service has been discontinued by shutting off the water supply, or in any other manner, for the person to re-connect the same without the consent of the City. Any person violating this Subsection shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be punished by a fine of not less than $25.00 nor more than $50.00 for each offense, and an additional penalty of not less than $25.00 for each day said violation continues. 
(Prior code,  10.10.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Division 3 - Emergency Restrictions 

Sec. 13-2-410. - Restriction of water use in emergency. 
    At any time when, in the opinion of the City Manager, an emergency exists as to the use of City water and the supply should be conserved for basic human needs, the City Manager may impose such restrictions with approval of the City Council as to the use of City water as he or she may deem necessary and proper for the conservation of such water. 
(Prior code,  10.12.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-420. - Restrictions effective upon posting. 
    Emergency water restrictions shall become effective when said restrictions are posted in the office of the City Clerk. 
(Prior code,  10.12.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-430. - Water use contrary to restrictions prima facie evidence of violation. 
    Any use of water contrary to such emergency restrictions at any outlet shall be prima facie evidence of a violation of such regulations by the person to whom such water is metered. 
(Prior code,  10.12.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-2-440. - Penalties. 
(a)  Penalty. Any person found guilty of violating this Article or any part thereof shall be fined in accordance with the provisions of Section 1-4-20 of this Code. 
(b)  Additional penalty. The water of any person charged with a violation of this Division shall be disconnected forthwith by the Superintendent of Water Works pending the ultimate disposition of those charges. Any person whose water has been so disconnected may have the same reconnected by posting with the Municipal Judge a bond running to the City, with a surety to be approved by the Municipal Judge, of not less than $300.00, conditioned upon the appearance of such person for trial thereon and payment of any penalties and charges arising therefrom. 
(Prior code,  10.12.040, 10.12.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 3 - Sewer Regulations 
Division 1 - General Provisions 

Sec. 13-3-10. - Purpose and intent. 
    The purpose and intent of this Article is to establish a procedure and method for the City to set, adjust, modify, amend or waive its tap fees for connection to the City water and sewer system. 
(Prior code,  10.14.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-3-20. - District sanitary sewer system created. 
    The sanitary sewer system of the City consists of the Rocky Ford District Sanitary Sewer District Number One and of all other lateral and house sewers connected with said sewer system. They are designed to carry off all liquid house waste. The main sewer is hereafter referred to as the main sewer . All other sewers in streets and alleys connected therewith are herein called lateral sewers . The sewers on private property leading to lateral sewers are called house sewers . 
(Prior code,  10.14.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-3-30. - Sewer regulations. 
(a)  Injury or pollution of sewer system prohibited. No person shall break, injure or remove any portion of any manhole, lamp pole, flush tank, catch basin or any part of the sewer system, or throw and deposit or cause to be thrown or deposited in any sewer opening receptacle any vegetables, parings, ashes, cinders, rags or any other matter or thing whatsoever, except feces, urine, the necessary water closet paper and liquid house and mill slops. 
(b)  City Manager authorized to prevent discharge of injurious matter into sewer system. The City Manager shall have the power to stop and prevent from discharging into the sewer system any private sewer or drain through which such substances are discharged which are liable to injure the sewers or obstruct the flow of sewage. 
(c)  Regulations for burial of sewage within City limits. It shall be unlawful to deposit or bury in the ground or on any premises within the City limits any night soil, grease trap or cesspool matter. 
(d)  Connections. 
(1)  The charge for tapping onto or connection with the sewer system of the City shall be as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. 
(2)  No sewer taps shall be made except by the City. All taps fees shall be paid when the request for the tap is made. For each tap, the City will furnish the labor and one tap fitting. The cost of excavation, if done by the City, and repair of main lines, if broken by parties other than City personnel, will be charged to the party requesting the connection. All previous tap charges based upon the City's charges are to be in addition to the above-stated tap fees. All fees and charges paid in accordance with this Section shall be deposited into the Sewer Fund, together with all other sewer fund revenues derived by the City. Upon motion of the City Council, such funds may be transferred to the General Fund from time to time, and, upon motion of the City Council, such funds may be determined as necessary. The City Council may by resolution reduce or increase the rate of sewer tap charge or change the classification for tapping and connection of any residential or business establishment. 
(e)  Limitations. No person shall connect or cause to be connected to the City sanitary sewer system or continue to use any connection to the sewer system for drainage other than waste from plumbing fixtures. 
(Prior code,  10.14.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-3-40. - Reservation of sewer tap. 
(a)  Sewer taps may be reserved for a period of no more than six months upon payment to the City of the tap fee in effect upon the date of reservation. Reservation of sewer taps may be renewed from time to time for periods of six months each upon payment of the difference between the tap fee in effect upon the date of reservation and any additional tap fee rate in effect upon the date of renewal. Failure to renew the reservation as provided in this Section shall terminate the reservation, and all monies paid under reservations shall be forfeited to the City. 
(b)  Upon payment to the City of all costs for materials, labor, equipment and pavement replacement, the City shall install and connect the meter. 
(Prior code,  10.14.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-3-50. - Grease trap, privy vault and cesspool regulations. 
(a)  Grease traps to be cleaned yearly. All grease traps shall be cleaned at least once a year, or more often if ordered by the City Manager. 
(b)  Cleaning privy vaults and cesspools. All privy vaults and cesspools must be cleaned whenever the contents thereof are within two feet of the top or surface of the ground or cleaned or disinfected at any other time after notice from the City Manager. 
(c)  Discontinuing use of vaults and cesspools. Whenever the use of any vault or cesspool is discontinued, such vault or cesspool must be cleaned to within two feet of the surface of the ground, and the remainder shall be thoroughly disinfected and filled up with earth or other suitable material, done to the satisfaction of the City Manager. 
(d)  License required for professional cleaners of vaults and cesspools. No person shall clean any vault or cesspool for hire, nor carry on the business known as vault cleaner, without first having obtained from the City a license therefor. The person applying for such license shall pay to the City Clerk the sum set forth in the City's Fee Schedule for one year. Said license may be revoked any time for cause. The person shall be equipped with the most modern and approved appliances for such work. 
(e)  Regulations for removal of contents of vaults, grease traps and cesspools. The contents of the privy vaults, grease traps or cesspools within the limits of the City shall not be removed therefrom, nor shall the same be transported through any street, alley or public place within the City, except in the most improved sanitary manner, through or by means of air-tight tanks if soft and mixed with water; and, if solid or dry, in steel-tight covered tanks in such a manner as shall prevent the escape of any noxious or offensive odors and preserve such contents from sight or exposure during transportation. All tools, appliances and vehicles shall be maintained in a sanitary condition and subject to the inspection and under the direction of the City Manager. 
(Prior code,  10.14.040; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Division 2 - Sewer Rates and Charges 

Sec. 13-3-110. - Charges for sewer and disposal systems. 
(a)  Charges for use of sewer and disposal system. A monthly charge as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule for the use of the sewer and sewage disposal systems within the City for each connection shall be paid to the City. 
(b)  Monthly charges. The monthly charge for such use outside the City shall be double the charge itemized above for similar types of users; provided, however, that the City Council may, by resolution, reduce or increase the rate of charge or change the classification of any residential or business establishment as above provided, and may further establish the charge to be assessed against any future industrial or business operation. 
(Prior code,  10.14.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-3-120. - Collection of charges. 
    The sewer charges set out in Section 13-3-110 above shall be added and made a part of the monthly water rental bill and shall be paid in the same manner and subject to the same regulations as provided for the payment of water bills. 
(Prior code,  10.14.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-3-130. - Discontinuance of service; lien. 
    A sewer charge shall constitute a lien upon any lot, land, building or premises served. In the event such charges are not paid when due, the service may be discontinued by the City without further notice by shutting off the sewer supply from such premises, or the City Clerk may certify the charges to the County Treasurer, to be placed by him or her upon the tax list for the current year and collected in the manner as other taxes are collected, with ten percent added thereto to defray the cost of collection. All laws of the State for the assessment and collection of general taxes, including all laws for sale of property for taxes and redemption thereof, shall be applicable hereunder. 
(Prior code,  10.14.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-3-140. - Reconnection unlawful. 
    It is unlawful, after sewer service has been discontinued by shutting off the sewer supply or in any other manner, for the person to reconnect the same without the consent of the City. 
(Prior code,  10.14.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-3-150. - Waiver of sewer tap fees. 
    No sewer tap onto the City sewer system shall be made except by the City after application and upon such terms and conditions as determined by the City Manager or as provided herein. All tap fees shall be paid when the request for the tap is made. For each tap, the City will furnish the labor and one tap fitting. The cost of excavation, if done by the City, and repair of main lines, if broken by parties other than City personnel, will be charged to the party requesting the connection. All fees and charges paid in accordance with this Article shall be deposited in the Sewer Fund, together with all other sewer fund revenues derived by the City. Upon motion of the City Council, such funds may be transferred to the General Fund from time to time, as may be determined necessary. The City Council may, by resolution, reduce or increase the rate of sewer tap charge or change the classification for tapping and connection of any residential or business establishment. The City Council shall be entitled to set, modify, amend, waive or otherwise determine the rates, charges or fees to be charged for tapping into or connecting onto the City sewer system. Said rates, charges or fees shall be set, modified, amended or waived from time to time by resolution of the City Council. 
(Prior code,  10.14.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-3-160. - Septic tank dumping fees. 
    No person shall dispose of wastes from septic tanks, seepage pits, grease traps or privies into the sewer system of the City until having notified the City Manager of the intention so to do at least two hours prior to such disposal. Upon such notification and prior to such disposal, the person shall pay a fee as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule for each vehicle disposing of such waste into the sewer system of the City. 
(Prior code,  10.14.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-3-170. - Penalties. 
    The violation of the provisions of this Article shall be punishable in accordance with the provisions of Section 1-4-20 of this Code. 
(Prior code,  10.14.050; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 4 - Water and Sanitary Sewer Main Extension 

Sec. 13-4-10. - Exclusive right of City to extend existing water lines. 
    In addition to the water mains already laid in connection with the water works of the City, the City is hereby authorized and empowered and hereby reserves the exclusive right to extend said mains upon, through, under and along all streets, alleys and parks within the City when proper, necessary and expedient so to do, for the purpose of supplying water to the inhabitants of the City. 
(Prior code,  10.06.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-4-20. - Water and sanitary sewer main extension outside City limits. 
    The City may permit and authorize, pursuant to the terms and conditions set forth below, any person, partnership, firm, corporation or unincorporated association (hereinafter called "applicant") whose property is located outside the municipal boundaries of the City, upon application to and in the discretion of the City Council, to connect to the water supply of the City and to the sanitary and/or storm sewer systems of the City upon the following terms and conditions: 
(1)  The location, size and extension of any water or sewer line and the point of connection shall be determined solely by the City Manager, and his or her judgment shall be final. 
(2)  Any application for connection, extension or use of water shall be accompanied by a connection fee in accordance with the City's Fee Schedule. 
(3)  The cost of all material and installation with appropriate metering devices, as required by the City Manager, shall be at the sole expense of the applicant. 
(4)  The applicant shall submit plans and specifications to the City Manager 30 days prior to the commencement of any construction for water and/or sewer lines. The applicant must have received approval of the plans and specifications as to all phases of construction, including size, depth, fill, backfill, trenching and other construction consideration, prior to commencement of any work. 
(5)  All inspections shall be accomplished by the City Manager, and he or she shall have the authority to reject any and all work which, in his or her opinion, does not conform to the approved plans and specifications. The City Manager shall have sole authority to refuse to deliver services until he or she has certified that all construction has been approved by him or her. 
(6)  Upon the completion of all construction and upon the commencement of use, all water and/or sewer main lines shall become the property of the City. 
(7)  The applicant shall furnish evidence to the City Manager that rights-of-way or easements for use have been obtained for all necessary installations and that, upon completion, all rights-of-way and/or easements for use shall be conveyed to the City without restriction. The City Manager may refuse to permit installation if free access by means of rights-of-way or nonrestrictive easements has not been obtained by the applicant. 
(Prior code,  10.06.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-4-30. - Charges for use. 
    Any applicant whose property is located outside the municipal boundaries of the City and who utilizes the City water, sewer or storm sewer system shall be required to pay water and sewer fees at twice the rate assessed customers located within the municipal boundaries. 
(Prior code,  10.06.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-4-40. - Extension upon annexation. 
    The applicant agrees that, as soon as the property to which the water and/or sewer extension has been made becomes eligible for annexation to the City pursuant to the annexation laws of the State, the applicant or the applicant's successor in interest is deemed to authorize the City to annex such property to the City, at the option of the City, at such time thereafter that the City, in its sole discretion, may determine. 
(Prior code,  10.06.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-4-50. - Maintenance of lines. 
    From and after the commencement of use by the applicant and as long as the payment of fees as provided for hereinabove are current, it shall be the duty of the City to maintain any and all water and/or sewer main lines. 
(Prior code,  10.06.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-4-60. - Delinquency of payments. 
    All payments for water and/or sewer use and facilities shall be subject to the same conditions, penalties, collections and regulations, including termination of services, as provided in this Chapter governing those matters for the inhabitants of the City. 
(Prior code,  10.06.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 5 - Fire Hydrants 

Sec. 13-5-10. - Exclusive use by authorized person. 
    All the fire hydrants constructed in the City for the purpose of extinguishing fires in the City are hereby declared to be public hydrants, and no person shall open any of the fire hydrants, attempt to draw water from the same or in any manner interfere with or injure any of the fire hydrants. 
(Prior code,  10.08.010; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-5-20. - Damage of public hydrants prohibited. 
    No person shall willfully or carelessly damage, break or injure any of the public fire hydrants or pollute or unnecessarily waste water at any such fire hydrants. 
(Prior code,  10.08.020; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-5-30. - Wrenches used exclusively by Fire Department. 
    No member of the Fire Department shall let out, suffer or permit any person to take the wrenches furnished to the Fire Department to be used in case of fire, or shall suffer or permit any of said wrenches furnished to the Fire Department to be taken from the hose house or fire station of the Fire Department, except as they accompany the fire equipment on occasions of fire or for other purposes connected with the Fire Department. 
(Prior code,  10.08.030; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 6 - Garbage and Refuse Collection 

Sec. 13-6-10. - Purpose and intent. 
(a)  It is the opinion of the City Council that it is necessary to regulate the collection, disposition and removal of garbage and rubbish within the City, in order to promote the health of its inhabitants, to suppress disease, to improve sanitary conditions and to prevent fire hazards. 
(b)  It is the purpose and intent of this Article to set forth the requirements, regulations and prohibitions concerning the collection, disposition and removal of garbage and refuse within the City, to establish a system of rates, charges and fees for that collection by the City, and to establish a landfill fee and charge for the use of the Otero County landfill. 
(Ord. No. 757,  1, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-20. - Definitions. 
    As used in this Article, the following words shall have the following meanings: 
    Apartments means dwelling units for more than one family where each family does not have garbage pickup as a single-family unit. 
    Garbage means all animal and vegetable waste resulting from the handling, preparation, cooking, consumption or storage of meats, fish, fowl, fruits or vegetables, excluding dead animals and slaughterhouse offal. 
    Landfill charge means a charge assessed per unit for dwellings designated for multiple families or multiple unrelated individuals where no City garbage services are purchased or where garbage services are purchased for the entire facility rather than by individual units. Examples include, but are not limited to, apartments, townhouses, nursing homes and assisted living facilities. Landfill charges defray per capita charges assessed by OCLI regardless of use of City garbage services. 
    Refuse means all hay, straw, shavings, excelsior, grass cuttings, paper or paper products, containers, boxes, glass, cans, bottles and material commonly known as rubbish or refuse, as are commonly produced in homes, stores and institutions, excluding, however, debris or rubbish from the construction, demolition or repair of buildings and other structures, trees and tree limbs, abandoned dead animals, large machinery, vehicles and furniture. 
    Single-family unit means a dwelling designed to house a single family. 
    Unit means each residence, business, apartment, mobile home, motel, hotel, residential rooms within a nursing home, residential rooms within an assisted living facility, school and other business establishment, residence and dwelling. 
(Ord. No. 757,  2, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-30. - Responsibility of owner, tenant or resident for disposal and removal. 
    The owner, lessor, agent, tenant or occupant of any house, dwelling or building where housekeeping, cooking or eating is done or where any commercial business is carried on in the City shall dispose of and remove garbage and refuse which may accumulate from such house, dwelling, building or commercial business. 
(Ord. No. 757,  3, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-40. - Collection and removal by City. 
(a)  The City has determined that it would be in the best interest of the residents of the City to provide garbage collection and removal services. The City is hereby authorized to provide garbage collection and removal services as appropriate and as determined by the City Council in its discretion. The City is further authorized to charge a fee to all persons who utilize the City's garbage collection services except as specifically provided herein. 
(b)  Nothing herein shall prohibit any person from hauling his or her own refuse to a landfill, provided same is done at a time when the landfill is officially open and the refuse is transported in such a manner so as to preclude any of the refuse from being deposited on any street, alley or other property in route. Any person hauling his or her own refuse shall not be excused from paying the applicable collection charge provided for herein for the collection of refuse for the City. Furthermore, any restaurant owner or the operator of a similar business having garbage fit for swine feeding may contract with any person to haul away such garbage. 
(Ord. No. 757,  4, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016; Ord. No. 936,  1, 7-24-2018 ) 
Sec. 13-6-50. - Fees for collection and removal. 
(a)  The owner or his or her agent or any person in possession of or occupancy of any residence, dwelling or apartment house with fewer than eight units shall pay for services provided by the City in the collection and disposal of garbage and refuse at rates determined by the City Council as set forth on the City's Fee Schedule. 
(b)  Any commercial industrial or mercantile establishment or apartment house with eight units or more are not required to utilize the services of the City for collection and disposal of garbage and refuse and are not required to pay the garbage collection fee or rates as set forth herein. In the event such commercial, industrial or mercantile establishment or apartment house with eight units or more elects to use the City's garbage collection and disposal services, it shall be required to pay a garbage collection fee for said services as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. 
(Ord. No. 757,  5, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-60. - Unauthorized dumping. 
    No person shall place, or cause to be placed, rubbish, trash or other waste materials in any Toter &reg;, Dumpster or other trash receptacle or container of another where no legal right of access to the container by virtue of ownership, leasehold, other tenancy or an agency relationship with the owner, lessee or other tenant exists. 
(Ord. No. 800,  1, 3-9-2004; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-70. - Receptacles and containers. 
(a)  All garbage for disposal shall be placed in bags or other appropriate receptacle made of material and of a size to be determined by the City. 
(b)  Refuse of such size, shape and weight that will fit into said bags shall also be placed therein, provided that institution and business refuse may be treated the same as garbage above, except as hereinafter provided. Refuse of such size, weight or shape not capable of being placed in such bags shall be placed in a container made of metal, plastic, pasteboard or wood, or other material acceptable to the City, which container, however, shall not exceed 50 pounds in weight when filled. Brush and trimmings less than five feet in length and other items easily tied in bundles weighing less than 50 pounds may be placed out for collection. Cardboard shipping containers shall be crushed and tied in bundles not exceeding 50 pounds. 
(Ord. No. 757,  6, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-80. - Disposal of other materials. 
    All rubbish, trash or other waste materials too bulky or heavy so as to be placed in bags or containers as set forth in Section 13-6-70 above, including but not limited to debris and rubbish resulting from the construction, repair and demolition of buildings and other structures, trees and tree limbs, industrial refuse, dead animals, machinery, vehicles, furniture and other like items, shall be removed and disposed of by the owner or occupant of the premises where the same are located at his or her own expense; provided, however, that nothing herein shall preclude the City from undertaking to remove any of these items, at its option and at charges to be determined by the City by resolution. 
(Ord. No. 757,  6, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-90. - Sealing of containers. 
    All bags of garbage or refuse, or a combination thereof, shall be securely fastened when placed outdoors for collection, or prior thereto, so as to preclude the intrusion of insects, rodents or animals therein; provided, however, that, prior to the placing of a bag out for collection, it need not be fastened at the top if it is at all times kept in a metal container or other receptacle approved by the City, which container shall have a tight-fitting lid and no defect sufficient to allow the intrusion of flies, rodents and insects therein. 
(Ord. No. 757,  6, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-100. - Placement for collection. 
(a)  Garbage and refuse, in proper containers as herein provided for, shall be placed out for collection at a convenient place in the alley or on the property of the user adjacent to the street and alley, or at such other convenient place as the City may from time to time determine with respect to individual properties or users. 
(b)  The City may permit a user to place said container at a place selected by the user; provided, however, that, if said spot selected is more than ten feet from the spot for collection designated by the City, the City may make an additional charge to the user over and above the regular collection charge. 
(Ord. No. 757,  7, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-110. - Frequency of collection. 
    Collection shall be made at such times and frequencies as the City may from time to time determine, acting in its administrative capacity. 
(Ord. No. 757,  8, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-120. - Authorization for collection of fees. 
(a)  The City Council shall by resolution establish charges for collection service for removal and hauling of garbage and refuse in the City, prescribe the time and manner of payment of such charges and adopt measures or regulations designed to enforce the payment thereof as, in its discretion, are necessary or desirable. Such resolution, when adopted, shall be of the same force and effect as if incorporated in this Section. 
(b)  Charges for garbage and refuse removed shall be a lien on the property served until paid in full. If payment of any such charge is not made within 90 days after the same is due, the City Clerk shall cause a notice of such charge to be given to the owner of such property by publishing the same for two consecutive weeks in a local newspaper, stating the amount of the charges. If the same are not paid within ten days thereafter, along with publication charges, the City Clerk shall certify such charges as assessed to the County Treasurer, to be placed on the tax rolls for the current year, to be collected in the same manner as taxes are collected, with a penalty of ten percent to defray the cost of collection as provided by state law. 
(Ord. No. 757,  9, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-130. - Billings. 
    The collection fees enumerated above shall be billed monthly in arrears, as a part of the water bill for each month. 
(Ord. No. 757,  10, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-140. - Liability of property owner; charges to constitute lien; action to collect charge. 
    Whether garbage and refuse are collected and removed by employees of the City or by persons under contract with the City for such purposes, in all instances where garbage or refuse is accumulated in any business establishment, house, dwelling or building where housekeeping, cooking or eating is done, the owner of such property shall be held personally liable for all charges imposed under this Article from the time such charges are due. Such charges shall become and remain a lien upon any such buildings or lots until such charges are paid, and such charges may be collected from any owner by an action at law or in equity, such action to be in the name of the City. Any such action may be prosecuted in any court having jurisdiction, and the action may be for the enforcement of the lien. Such lien shall attach to such buildings or lots upon which the garbage or refuse is procured, accumulated or kept. The property owner and/or customer of the City shall be liable for all costs, expenses and reasonable attorneys' fees incurred by the City in prosecuting any action for enforcement of this Article or collection of any fees associated herewith. 
(Ord. No. 757,  11, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-150. - Determination by resolution. 
    The City Council may, by resolution duly made and adopted by the City Council from time to time, determine and re-determine any of the following matters having to do with collection of garbage and refuse within the City: 
(1)  The method and manner of transporting garbage and refuse. 
(2)  The make, size, type and kind of bags. 
(3)  The adequacy of the containers for refuse. 
(4)  The places where garbage and refuse must be placed for collection. 
(5)  The hours, frequencies and route of collection by the City, and the hours the City dump shall be open. 
(6)  Fees for removal and/or collection. 
(7)  Land use fees. 
(8)  Establishment of other regulations deemed necessary and appropriate for garbage and refuse collection and removal in the City. 
(9)  Such other matters as may be necessary to effectively implement the provisions of this Article. 
(Ord. No. 757,  12, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-160. - Disturbing containers or contents prohibited. 
    No person shall disturb, destroy, mutilate, vandalize, remove, handle or otherwise disturb the garbage and refuse containers or contents which may have been placed for removal by the City or other garbage collector, except the owner, occupant, lessor or tenant of a residence, dwelling or building, or his or her employees, agents or persons legally collecting the same under this Article. 
(Ord. No. 757,  13, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-170. - Depositing garbage or refuse on public places or vacant lots prohibited. 
    It is unlawful for any person to throw, keep, place or deposit, or cause to be deposited, any garbage or refuse upon any street, alley, park or other public place or upon any vacant lot within the City, or to store or keep the same except as otherwise provided and required by this Article. 
(Ord. No. 757,  14, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-180. - Depositing garbage or refuse on private premises prohibited. 
    It is unlawful for any person to throw, keep, place or deposit or cause to be thrown, kept, placed or deposited any garbage, refuse, trash, rubbish, debris or other offensive matter on any private property or premises within the City limits, except as provided in this Article. 
(Ord. No. 757,  15, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-190. - Burning refuse and garbage prohibited. 
    No person shall at any time burn any refuse or garbage within the City limits. 
(Ord. No. 757,  16, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-200. - Establishment of landfill fees. 
    The owner or his or her agent or a person in possession or occupancy of any dwelling, residence, apartment house, store, commercial operation or business, or any and all other mercantile establishments shall pay a landfill fee to assist in defraying the cost of the ownership, development and operation of a county-wide landfill as set forth in the City's Fee Schedule. This fee shall apply to all persons in possession of or ownership of any dwelling, apartment house, store, business or other mercantile establishment, regardless of whether the City provides garbage collection and removal services to that person. 
(Ord. No. 757,  18, 9-28-1999; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-6-210. - Penalties. 
    It is unlawful for any persons to violate any provision of this Article. Any person violating the same shall, upon conviction, be punished in accordance with the provisions of Section 1-4-20 of this Code. 
(Prior code,  10.16.130; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
ARTICLE 7 - Water Enterprise 

Sec. 13-7-10. - Establishment of Enterprise. 
    There is hereby established, pursuant to the terms and provisions of the Water Activity Law, Article 45.1 of Title 37, C.R.S., the City of Rocky Ford Water Enterprise (the "Enterprise"). The Enterprise shall consist of the system which is the business represented by all of the City's water facilities and properties, now owned or hereafter acquired, whether situated within or without the City boundaries, including all present or future improvements, extensions, enlargements, betterments, replacements or additions thereof or thereto. The Enterprise shall have all of the authority, powers, rights, obligations and duties as may be provided or permitted by the Water Activity Law and the Colorado Constitution, and as may be further prescribed by ordinance or resolution of the City Council. 
(Ord. No. 849,  1, 6-10-2008; Ord. No. 914,  1, 2-9-2016) 
Sec. 13-7-20. - Governing Body. 
    The governing body of the Enterprise (the "Governing Body") shall be the City Council and shall be subject to all of the applicable laws, rules and regulations pertaining to the City Council. Whenever the City Council is in session, the Governing Body shall also be deemed to be in session.
